39472558.review: POSTAL Redux is a true remaster of the original game. It takes everything about the original and makes it fresh, new, and exciting all over again. It's fun, it's addicting, and it's multiplayer mode is superb. The only downside is that the loading times can still be slow, despite the developers patching this issues many times in the past. This game was definitely worth since this, and the rest of the series, is on sale for really cheap prices, so you can get this game and all the others for a few bucks. I believe that both versions are awesome in their own rights, but I'm most likely to play this one over the original due to it's fresh atmosphere, controls, and multiplayer. Be sure to take it with a grain of salt before you do, it's still just as frightening and dark as the original was.

39404293.review: O fato de terem melhorado os controles faz com que este remaster seja um martírio menor em relação à versão original, mas POSTAL precisaria de muito mais que controles melhorados e texturas em HD para tornar-se um bom jogo. A jogabilidade é repetitiva, tediosa, sem profundidade. Com exceção dos explosivos e do lança-chamas, praticamente todas as armas operam da basicamente mesma maneira (a escopeta tem o mesmo alcance de um rifle, e o disparo não cobre uma área em cone em frente à arma. É apenas um rifle, com dano um pouco maior, e disparo mais lento), o bjetivo de todas as fases é matar um determinado número de policiais e soldados antes que seja possível prosseguir (matar civis é opcional), e a perspectiva dos mapas é confusa, pois não fornece uma boa indicção do protagonista em relação aos inimigos, fazendo com que o jogador constantemente receba dano de forma injusta. Também tive a impressão de que o jogo quer ser levado a sério, sem a comédia (propositalmente) juvenil e escrachada da continuação, mas não funciona como forma de comentário social, por conta da abordagem simplista. Minha recomendação é a seguinte: se quiserem jogar algum POSTAL, pulem este, comprem o segundo, pois mesmo que não seja um jogo bom, objetivamente falando, vale o preço da promoção, e as risadas.

One of my favorite voice actors speaking behind the tinkling cheers of a never-ending stream of SMG bullets.
What's not to love?  Completed it on Nightmare and am going to come back to beat the rest of the achievements.
  
However, there's a strange freezing that happens in both single and multiplayer, generally near the start of levels, but the game never crashes due to it, so it's not entirely game-breaking.  If you end up having the same issue, just make sure not to fire / get hit by rockets or get lit on fire right at the start of the levels.

Besides that flaw, point-by-point a pretty damn good remake.  I played the old Postal on a friend's PC a while back, good to see back it in all it's glory, and a bit more with the expansion and Japanese level packs.

38309149.review:
Postal 1, famous violent misanthropic game from the days long gone, re-made in a new body with the "redux" second name. It is constantly updating even now, and offers at moment: a main campaign (straight from 1997), 6 new levels, multiplayer with co-op and deathmatch modes, and "carnage" mode, for the lovers of bloody killstreaks and c-c-combos!

Oh, well, and it's still dull. And rage-producing. That's my main niggle, by the way: the game which is supposed to channel aggression into innocuous pushing of buttons, in reality does the opposite: it maintains my anger, fuel it, to the point when I'm growling on the people around. I might be able even kick someone, like the trolls who loves pestering around webpages.

What's the fuel of this reaction? Well, for one, it's optimisation. Yes, even now, with all updates of the version 4.2.1, the game engine still crushes, the loading screens still taking more time to proceed than booting of my Windows 10. And the game freezes for about 2-5 seconds on the start of every level, just when you engaging in the first shootout...
Second half of this god-awful feeling the game provides, yes, it's about pointless and mindless killing of dummy people. Which gets repetative just on the first level, and never evolves into anything worthwhile. The AI is still not good, the hitboxes are peculiar and the weaponry is odd. 

On the bright side, the game's easy enough (with glitches unlocking the exit before any kills) and fair enough with achievements, so, if you're an achievement hunter, you can play the game just for the badge. On the general score, though... It's not the best pick. I'd vouch for Hotline Miami myself, for the better story, visuals, and challenge. As of mark, 6/10. But no, I don't like the game, so, it's downvote from me. Not that it was really objectively, but... I'm just saying, you know. You can play it and make your own opinion.

38303105.review: A new version of the 1997 cult classic, well worth a buy.

38294958.review:
TL; DR: Redux is a superior version of Postal that adds replay value and congruent atmosphere to one of the darkest games available on Steam. 

Postal: Redux is a mostly faithful remaster, and it’s differences are highly subjective. On the whole, I would recommend Redux over the original simply because it retains most of what built the original’s atmosphere while adding to the gameplay, making it feel like a more complete package.

Much of the time with older games, their low resolutions and pixelated graphics made all the art meld together cleanly despite their primitive nature. Much of the time when updating graphics to look similar to the original’s low resolution, remasters can end up looking incongruent and “cartoon-ish.” A good example of this not going too well is StarCraft Remastered, which ends up looking less cohesive than its original because of its higher resolution textures, rather than the other way around. 

Postal Redux suffers from this but not nearly as bad. As a matter of fact, the art in the game as a whole fits together better than the original. For example, the loading screens of the original Postal were a weird mix of some obvious drawings, some that looked almost like photographs, and some that just looked like weird photoshops, all of which still looks different from the art in the gameplay. Redux on the whole looks more like a cartoon, but instead stays more consistent with it’s art. All the loading screens fit together better, and fit better with the gameplay art.

Similar to the original, Redux’s gameplay is pretty straightforward and can get tedious after a while. However, a first playthrough of Postal should be more about soaking in the dark atmosphere, and should be less focused on the mediocre combat. On a second playthrough, play Rampage mode. It makes the gameplay so much more exciting simply with score attack elements and electric guitars. It truly is the best way to replay this game. Only issue I had was technical, as my mouse kept stuttering about halfway through. The devs are aware of this issue on the community forums though.

38195014.review:
5/10
Uma observação notória e cômica entre os que conhecem a trilogia Postal é o quão diferente um é do outro, isso, em companhia da má reputação do principio da saga, levaram vários a acreditar que esse logo sobretudo serviu como uma estratégia para chamar o publico utilizando conceitos aterrorizantes e contestados, para que com a atenção do público, eles possam fazer uma sequência cargando uma reputação em que fosse possível juntar uma comunidade mais satisfeita com seu trabalho, vendo agora que há uma reconstrução da tão mal recebida entrada, a consideração dos desenvolvedores para tornar isso real é prova o restante que eles contemplavam o valor do primeiro mais do que se é extraído da hipótese. Para seres capazes de entender com mais cuidado o surgimento dessa suposição, devemos relembrar o impacto do primeiro sobre a mídia no período em que estava sendo promovido vulgarmente. Lançado em 14 de novembro de 1997, sem demora havia sido banido em mais de 10 países, recebeu baixas notas e foi alvo de críticas entre toneladas de turmas que tratavam de tópicos a respeito de vídeo-games na época. As avaliações negativas eram justificáveis em alguns casos, já que de fato as concepções formuladas para torna-lo jogável por grande parte eram medíocres, de qualquer modo, existiram aqueles que se aproveitaram disso para não explora-lo a fundo e critica-lo só pela superfície da temática principal, que é baseada em cometer um massacre, conseqüentemente também o fator que o levou para controvérsias.

O que este busca representar é o dentro da perspectiva distorcida de um psicopata, um afrouxado bom de tiro condenado ao ostracismo que imagina estar se vingando do mundo e fazendo a coisa certa com sua série de matanças. Começa tudo afinal, com o protagonista eliminando seu vizinho que pós reconhecimento da policia, provoca-lhe uma estimulação para iniciar um genocídio durante a região inteira, que vai piorando de lugar para lugar, tornando-se mais dificultoso com até as forças armadas em sua volta. As razões para a má repercussão são um tanto que obvias, o que se deve ser apontado entretanto, é que a obra é só uma representação, portanto não há uma mensagem por trás dos episódios e logo só acha-se uma cedência neutra. A narrativa é contada por dentro de anotações feitas no diário desse assassino, que são transmitidas para ti nas telas em que o nível está carregando, por elas, há uma tentativa do emissor em justificar tudo. Todos esses registros são um tanto que ocultos, porque são curtos, vagos e de vez em quando só servem para fortalecer uma ou duas suposições que automaticamente criarás durante os acontecimentos se estiveres no minimo dando importância. Os desenvolvedores possuem aquela exclusiva atitude de "cada um tem sua própria interpretação :^)" que por conta disso levaram alguns usuários (como o Zangado) a considera-lo como um produto sem historia alguma, que é um engano. Se há enunciados em algum canto da diegese que são consistentes com a sequência de acontecimentos observáveis, então alguma coisa há, poxa! Isso está evidente até no que venho posteriormente em 2003 para implementar mais para a franquia, na qual ele faz um trocadilho no cemitério de seu mundo material onde encontra-se um túmulo que está grafado "Descanse em paz, história de POSTAL" para zombar do fato de que nesse não há um conto coerente ocorrendo como havia-se no inicio, provando a existência de uma tentativa de narração no passado. Enfim, essa conduta dos criadores em aceitar os elementos narrativos como transparentes e que por consequência, deva ser interpretado e respondido por nós usuários em razão da ausência de explicitude, a relatividade das escrituras e o vazio não preenchido das questões não respondidas, é um tipo de comportamento que reverencio, já que ter mistério dentre uma situação monstruosa serve como encorajamento para os jogadores que por resultado, faz com que no minimo consigam obter respostas vias suas interpretações que sentiram a curiosidade de obtê-las, ainda que no fim, talvez uns permaneçam incertos.

Faça um favor para si mesmo e não compre-o com o intuito de jogar a campanha original, uma vez que no minimo por base de experiência própria, não posso afirmar que me diverti tanto. É por certo o lazer existente nas buscas pelas conquistas que fazem com que tentes múltiplos modos de se zerar as trajetórias, seja matando só os hostis impedindo a morte de pedestres comuns, ou exterminando todos presentes na tal região, ou talvez tentando completar todos os níveis da dificuldade Nightmare, etc. Esses, são satisfatórios de completar como seria nos jogos que possuem numerosas conquistas. O que é, no entanto, o fim perante os meios? Eu aprecio, a liberdade que se tem durante o passar dos níveis, de exploração e a boa armoria de se optar. Mas, não estaria eu em algum compromisso com a verdade se dissesse que o caminho que levou para eu alcançar todas essas conquistas foi um espiritoso, porque o que há no modo de partida oficial não é suficiente para agradar-te até o desfecho, as quatros formas de se eliminar o homem durante o intermédio do level são por balas, execuções, fogo e explosões, que parece eficiente para todo o passatempo de traçar a narrativa do inicio até o fim, porém não é! Mesmo com esta variedade o fluir inteiro que ocorre durante tua jogatina é casual, e se não for isso, pelo móbil de que estás jogando em uma dificuldade maior, ele substituirá esse transcorrer que incentivará um estado prudente em ti, que nesse caso, torna a prática do morticínio desagradável. Essa casualidade que denunciei antes e denunciarei mais a fundo agora, trata-se da facilidade de desempenhar as ações, a essência é mirar e atirar, desviar dos projeteis e defender-se cobrindo-se atrás dos objetos com colisões, estes são fundamentos que não são o bastante para diversificar tua performance, pois em constância, repetem-se. As propriedades de combate de cada classe dos inimigos vareia, sufoco é como as dessemelhanças são tão pequenas que não faz quase diferença alguma, morrerão talvez todos em um, dois ou três tiros de uma espingarda, que se pode efetuar em segundos, então, nem isso é capaz de salvar o raso encontrável nesses campos. Se houvesse, no minimo, mais variações para entreter-se, como um complementar de armas novas como no 2 e o Paradise Lost, ou talvez um cenário destrutível como em Hatred, eu não teria de manifestar sobre isso. 

A verdadeira diversão descobrível situa-se em tentar alcançar a maior classificação (+A) no Rampage Mode, é aqui onde, inclusive, os detalhes são importantes, visto que o sistema de pontuação avalia inúmeros aspectos que terás de levar em conta na realização do exercício, o placar considera dados como; combos, criatividade, execuções e tempo, ainda este faz uma balanceamento virtuoso da quantia de pontos que cada arma dará em seu uso. Serás obrigado a formular uma rota em cada mapa na qual nesta seja-se capaz de continuar com o teu combo até o fim do desafio, deverás matizar a tua aplicação com as armas, porque usar a mesma dará um resultado menos efetivo do que daria caso contrário, há muitas outras minúcias que necessitarão de sua atenção, e cargar a obrigação de adaptar-se a essa grande competição para atingir a aprovação máxima do julgador é incrível, em razão de não só deterás a satisfação de obter a conquista mais difícil ou aquela satisfação de até que enfim limpar um território, bem como verás que o meio de uma vez por todas ganhou importância. No decorrer das coisas, o sentimento de tensão estará dentro de ti, aquele sentimento do relógio correndo mais rápido, da busca por mais munição, do combo quase acabando e da esperança de alcançar o desejado. Todos estarão presentes, e nada é melhor do que isso.

Postarei na seção de comentários outras pequenas considerações nas quais não fui possibilitado de comentar nesta análise. Triste de anunciar que o limite de caracteres da Steam é um pé no saco!

38171353.review:
Нет слов. Это просто слив.
Первый раз я загружал игру с торрента и играл в пиратскую версию. Игра работала стабильно, но для меня эта игра была сильным разочарованием. Уже нет оригинальной атмосферы POSTAL - игра звучит очень попсово, модели персонажей кривые, отвратительные и никак не сочетаются с окружающей средой. Если тот же самый Hatred пытается использовать возможности UE4, использование этого движка в POSTAL Redux не оправдано - для игры с нарисованными фонами это просто дополнительная нагрузка на систему и не более. 
Но почему же я решил купить эту игру, если она мне не понравилась? Только из жалости к разработчикам с надеждой, что новая сборная солянка модмейкеров в RWS когда-нибудь сможет сделать что-нибудь дойстойное, во что не будет стыдно играть, как в оригинальные Postal и Postal 2/AW от старой команды. Но в последнее время я всё-таки жалею, что не вернул деньги за покупку, потому что вера в них давно ушла. Не могу рекомендовать эту игру ни фанатам постала, ни рядовым игрокам, так как в этом недоредуксе нет ничего такого, что могло бы хоть чем-нибудь зацепить так же, как оригинальная игра.

37814980.review:
Well, one of the most controversial games ever made, remastered. 

Postal, the original killing spree simulator, remade in Unity engine. Looks better, plays more or less the same. The expierence is streamlined, some mechanics rebalanced, but it's the same game - just repackaged.  Is it bad? Not at all. I found it still enjoyable, even after all these years. Nostalgia factor is pretty strong here, so if you're a young gamer, you could be a little underwhelmed. Still, getting it on sale won't hurt your wallet. 
So, what is Postal? Simple twin stick shooter with a dark twist. You're a psychotic killer, exterminating everything in your way. Yep, lighting up a parade with a flamthrower will happen here. 

Redux version includes all levels (with add ons), new co-op mode and challenge mode. Full package, few hours of stress relieving, mindless slaughter. Sometimes, it's all you need.

Решил я все-таки написать свой юбилейный 100-ый обзор(хотя кому они нужны).
И так переиздание первого Постала.Ждал его еще с момента анонса и после того,как страница игры появилась в steam стал откладывать деньжата.И вот 21 мая он вышел.
Сразу плюсы.
1-Управление.Одназночно управление стало гораздо удобнее(на все 100%).Но из-за этого пострадала сложность игры.Игру прошел на hard е и сложно лишь было на последних 2-ух уровнях.
2-Атмосфера безумия.Тут и так все понятно(это же Постал).
3-Анимированный загрузочный экран.Это не такой уж и большой плюс,но тоже идет в копилку.
4-Цена.Игра стоит в полной сумме 350 Рублей.И она себя вполне окупает.
5-Переход на уровни.(Это тоже не такой уж и большой плюс,но все же как и в случае с 3 плюсом идет в копилку.)Если в оригинале нужно было нажать f1(1997 год все дела).То здесь нужно идти в какую-то определенную точку,дабы завершить уровень.
6-Озвучка и звуки.В отличии от оригинала в игре качественный звук.И Чувак говорит голосом Чувака(как это бы странно не звучало,думаю вы поняли.)И музыка в главном меню,особенно добавляет атмосферы безумия.
7-ИИ.На мой взгляд местные болванчики ведут себя адекватно,по сравнению с оригиналом.
8-Оружие.Оружия здесь больше,чем в оригинале.
9-Поддержка контроллера.Тут все ясно.
10-Концовка.Концовку переделали.(Не буду говорить на какую,пройдете и увидите.Не люблю спойлерить)
Насчет графики...Игра сделана на Unreal Engine 4.И графика в этой игре.И не плохая и не хорошая.Эффекты выглядят хорошо,да и модели прорисованы хорошо.
Теперь к минусам.Он тут один:
Продолжительность.Игру можно спокойно пройти за час(на easy или на NormaL),если хотите задержаться в игре ставьте hard или запустите режим rampage.
Подводя итог,хочу сказать,что RWS действительно постарались сделать отличный redux(прислушивались к мнениям игроков и все-такое)И у них это получилось.Надеюсь,что RWS сделают redux второго Постала и переделают убогий третий Постал(который угробила не RWS,а Аккела).Рекомендую брать(особенно фанатам Постала(коим я и являюсь))
8.5/10.
Надеюсь кому-то было интересно читать мой обзор.Играйте только в хорошие игры.P.S.Hatred-это калька с Постала(причем не очень хорошого качества,в отличии от Постала(1997-ого года)).И еще один P.S.Надеюсь в последующих патчах добавят co-op.
В августе вышел патч в котором добавили co-op.

36571371.review:
"...w dniu dzisiejszym w Las Vegas doszło do masakry, z okna jednego z hoteli jakiś człowiek zaczął strzelać do tłumu zebranego na koncercie. W wyniku zdarzenia jest kilkudziesięciu zabitych i kilkuset rannych ludzi...Nieznane są motywy zabójcy, według zeznań świadków człowiek ten niczym się nie wyróżniał, nie był agresywny na codzień i był przykładnym obywatelem..."

Czasamy nie potrzeba motywu. Gdy siedzisz w wygodnym fotelu i widzisz te wszystkie brednie w TV, a twoje oczy zachodzą krwią i rządzą mordu na widok upadającego świata, wtedy...wtedy włącz sobie Postala.

Gra w tym roku obchodzi 20-ste urodziny. Postal jest grą w której spełniają się wszystkie koszmary. Nieznajomy wychodzi ze swojej chatki i zaczyna strzelać do policji, która zakłóciła jego sielski dzień...traci kontrole i idzie przez miasta zwyczajnie strzelając, każde zabójstwo go cieszy, a rządza krwi tylko się zwiększa z minuty na minutę. Tu nie ma motywu, czy też powodu po co? Bo tak, bo wszystko mnie wkur... i tyle.

Dość bogaty arsenał broni którą zdobywamy w trakcie gry mocno urozmaica rozgrywkę. Oczywiście koktajl mołotowa i miotacz ognia to broń nr1. Wystarczy podpalić kilkanaście osób demonstrujących przed jakimś sklepem i patrzeć jak w agoni krzyków zaczynają biegać po całym mieście aż nie spłoną. Grę należy traktować umownie, ktoś zapyta co może cieszyć w bezsensownym zabijaniu na różne sposoby w tej grze? To chyba ten przesadzony humor, pod płaszczykiem beznamiętnej rzezi, gra przekazuje nam bezsens tego świata. Wyśmiewa powagę sytuacji i pokazuje, że tak naprawdę wszystko co robimy jest umowne i trwa tylko w tej danej chwili. Ostatecznie Postal popada w szaleństwo, zatraca się we własnym umyśle i umiera powielokroć w każdej minucie życia która mu została...to już nie jest człowiek, to potwór z naszych koszmarów, a przykład z Las Vegas pokazuje, że może nie być fikcją....

Lepiej więc odpal Postala zanim Twoje oczy nabiegną zbytnio krwią...

[h1]POSTAL REDUX: [/h1]
Czy warto zakupić Postala w tej wersji? Odpowiedź brzmi zdecydowanie warto. Nowa wersja postala to poprawione modele postaci, wyższe rozdzielczości tła oraz mnóstwo dodanych efektów. Dodatkowo ta wersja gry zawiera coop do 4-rech graczy a także tryb rampage dla pojedynczego gracza, który polega na przechodzeniu układów na punkty wraz z końcową oceną. Jest to najlepsza odsłona postala godna przydomka redux w tytule. POLECAM.

PLUSY:

- Poprawiono praktycznie wszystko względem oryginału.
- Dużo kosmetycznych filtrów graficznych
- Nowe tryby w tym coop, rampage i deadmatch.
- Gra oprócz głównej kampani zawiera też dwie inne dodatkowe kampanie.
- Niczym nie skrępowana rozwałka przy użyciu sporej ilości broni.
- Ragdoll

MINUSY:

- Czasami gra odrobinę przycina przy dużej ilości przeciwników(Bardzo rzadko)
- AI przeciwników nadal nie imponuje
- Brak nowych map

OCENA:
7/10

Maybe the multiplayer experience will be more fun, but I highly doubt it's a game changer.

Conclusion: Buy only if you really like RWS and want to toss them some money for support or if you just want the badge(s) and backgrounds. Despite this technically being a negative review. I will upvote because I think RWS tried, and I don't want to sink this game's rating by any amount. Maybe I can encourage them to make a few changes, but I doubt it.

35909942.review:
The ultimate version of the misanthropic cult classic.

Postal, as weird and sick as it might be to admit this, might just be one of my favourite game series of all time. Let it be known that no, I'm not saying it's perfect. It is far from a good game, but it's a game that works and doesn't fuck around. Postal 2 was a mind-blowing black comedy FPS that gave no shits and was aware of it's offensive nature, and Postal 3, while fundamentally just a terrible game, at least tried to have that old school Postal feel and transplant it into a next gen body. But nothing will compare to the original 1997 game, the one that caused the original outrage, the one that shocked the world, and the one that remains the black sheep of ultra-violent video games.

With Running With Scissors recognizing the demand for Postal, with it's sequel being a greenlight success story and the orignal game getting a second life here on Steam with a new twisted generation eager to run through it's ghastly gauntlet of gore and grotesquerie, it seems that revamping the first game for newer systems would be the way to go. And boy howdy, did they deliver.

Postal Redux is special because, like the infamous Brutal Doom mod, it creates a perspective on the game to make it more like how gamers (and moral crusaders) viewed the original version way back in '97. It's more visceral and insane, taking the fast-paced twin-stick violence to new heights. It's far more depraved and it revels in it. Sure, the basic gameplay and mechanics haven't changed, but everything sounds better, plays smoother, and with the Postal Dude's now iconic bass-tone growl commentating on the chaos, how can any Postal fan resist?

As one of those Postal fans, all I can say is this is the game to get. With even more single-player options, multiplayer out the wazoo, and a sense of madness that feels reinvigorated and nostalgic, this is THE version of Postal to get. It's not an improvement. It's a fucking revolution.

В сюжетном плане ничего не изменилось. Главный герой, обозлённый на весь мир, выходит в собственный крестовый поход, расстреливая всё живое на пути. Противостоят ему полиция, спецназ, военные и агрессивно настроенные обыватели. В качестве мишеней в игре присутствуют также мирные жители, автоматические турели и… страусы. Последние, кстати, нередко появляются в самых неожиданных местах.

Геймплей, в принципе, остался тем же. Важным нововведением стала возможность самостоятельно настроить управление. Кроме того, Postal: Redux поддерживает возможность играть с геймпада, что многие геймеры сочтут весьма удобным. Впрочем, управление с помощью клавиатуры и мыши также не вызывает никаких проблем. Простая и интуитивно понятная механика игры не требует много времени на освоение.

Кардинальным изменениям подверглась графическая составляющая. Разработчики перевели свой первый проект на современный движок Unreal Engine 4, заново отрисовав всю визуализацию. При этом оригинальная психоделическая атмосфера не была нарушена. Выйдя в таком виде в 1997 году, проект произвел бы настоящий фурор. Да и на фоне современного игропрома графика в Postal: Redux выглядит вполне сносно.

35162870.review:
Отличный римейк приятной аркады.  По содержанию это:

1. Оригинальная кампания - 16  уровней
2. Дополнение Special Delivery - 4 уровня
3. Японские локации - 2 уровня (раньше присутствовали только в японском издании 1999 года).
4. Новый неигровой финальный уровень. В оригинале он происходил в школе, и хоть и был бескровным, разработчики всё же решили, что это перебор и заменили другой сценкой.

Игра сделана заново, перерисована с нуля и стала выглядеть заметно современней. Игровые изменения оправданы - расставленные всюду бочки взрываются быстрее, став  полезным элементом боя; дробовик и автоматический дробовик теперь независимы по боеприпасам; убрано нелепое завершение уровня по F1  ;)

Основной минус - релиз технически шероховат. После патчей ушла проблема долгих загрузок, но у многих появились фризы. У меня они были редки (разово в начале уровня),  кому-то  повезло меньше. Возможно, исправят - игра до сих пор патчится, хоть и не быстро. 

В целом же - однозначно рекомендую любителям 
а) первого Постала 
б) второго Постала 
в) кровавого беспредела на улицах виртуальных городов :)

Played it for a bit, the game's greatest weakness is for those that don't have the love or nostalgia for the series. It was special for its time, but today it feels repetitive. I will only recommend this for people that really love the original; for anyone else, it isn't something you will really enjoy for multiplayer. 

Infinite ammo and the giant swarm of enemies makes the game feel less about about aiming or running and gunning and more about standing carefully in the same spot. Because of this and the fact killing doesn't feel rewarding, you are focused more on not dying and less on killing, there is no rewarding feeling of accomplishment, it feels more like "well, I survived..."


The only individuals that might match my opinion are those that also get tired quickly of games like Alien Swarm, Hell Divers, etc. While Hell Divers has a few hours of gameplay, this has maybe an hour tops.

33572434.review:
Strictly an upgrade of the original Postal : 6 extra levels, improved character sprites and controls and a few new gamemodes. The gameplay is more similar to a twin-stick shooter now but you should still use the same tactics in higher difficulties, namely trying to blast multiple opponents together or kiting them at the edge of your screen. Even though it has a title that implies lots of maniac shooting and carelessness, Postal really makes you work for your kills.

It's a 10/10 for me. I would recommend it to all fans of isometric/top-down shooters and to those that like the Postal series in general. It does not dissapoint.

33496082.review:
The classic game, Postal, redone in Unreal Engine 4. It's Postal with better visuals and better controls. Postal: Redux also includes the original levels, the expansion levels, and an all new level. It also adds a new weapon, the Revolver. A single shot, somewhat slow-firing bullet weapon that can kill individual enemies pretty quickly, and even against small group of enemies.

The new modes are definitely welcome. They include Rampage, Co-op, and Deathmatch. However, I haven't had time at the moment to play them much, if at all, so I can't say much about them.

Your victims' screams and moans don't seem to sound as agonizing and frequent as the original game, though, and I thought it's a bit of a letdown. I know it may be disturbing for me to say that, but it could have made the game more shocking.

Also, sometimes the enemies feel a bit too much like bullet sponges.

Still, I like this game. If you liked Postal 1 but are on the fence about this game, the inclusion of the expansion pack levels and the new modes may convince you to buy this.

33478602.review:
Что ж, если вы не очередной хомячок, уповающий на одну ностальгию, вы можете помнить серьезные проблемы оригинальной Postal 1997 года. Будучи шутером, в ней тяжело было сконцентрироваться на точных попаданиях, стрельба была слишком кучной, при этом противопоставляя толстых врагов и их частый ответный огонь по вам, как бы вы не старались. К тому же, большинство арсенала было просто малоэффективно. Поэтому даже на самой низкой сложности в нее больно играть. 

В этом переиздании уже не так, оригинальная компания без проблем проходится за час реального времени. Попадания теперь сквозные на всю длину выстрела, целиться мышкой и попадать легко, а враги относительно быстро умирают даже от стандартного автомата, который в оригинале лишь ужасал. На удивление, двустволке все еще нужно 2 выстрела, чтобы убить врага. Даже если стрелять в упор. Т.е. урон от попадания не зависит от расстояния выстрела, но при этом это оружие самое практичное во всей игре. Один выстрел заставляет врага пошатнуться, а второй добивает. Попробуйте пройти игру на стандартной сложности только с этой пушкой и вряд ли у вас будут серьезные сложности. Хотя молотов, хоть и удобен против скоплений врагов, заставляет подставляться под пули и нередко поджигает самого игрока, врезаясь в препятствие. В целом, двустволка, аа12 и магнум действительно практичные, чего не сказать о ракетнице, напалме, гранатах и минах.

В остальном же, игровая концепция осталась прежней - нужно всего лишь убить на карте достаточное количество охранников порядка, после чего откроется выход с уровня. Нужно ли говорить о примитивности поведения врагов и шутерной механики здесь, перекочевавшей из оригинала? У врагов остался определенная зона триггера, другими словами, они не отреагируют на вас, если вы не подойдете достаточно близко. Некоторые реагируют на выстрелы поблизости и начинают ваше преследование, но в целом картина одна. Болванчики, расставленные в закоулках, зданиях, на дорогах и где угодно, ждущие вашего появления. Как шутер, же, вероятно, на максимальной сложности, она потребует больше концентрации, но на стандартной, с точки зрения которой и справедливее оценивать игру, все аркадно до ужаса. Позиционирование оружия работает слабо, двустволка одинакова на средней и близкой дистанции, а еще для нее много патронов. При этом, враги в бронежилетах и без, требуют одинакового количества попадания из нее. И до кучи - все умирают с двух попаданий из нее.

Но если говорить в общем плане, то на карте слишком много мешающих для движения обьектов, враги разбросаны далеко друг от друга, а при этом, возможность уйти из под выстрела вообще как-либо не предусмотрена. Т.е. это игра, в которой вас гарантированно ранят кучу раз, независимо от вашей природной ловкости. Шутер в изометрии - это вообще специфическое явление, все-таки жанр пошел от 3D, в котором позиционирование с нанесением и избежанием урона происходит как нужно, создавая правильную динамику боя. Поэтому сеттинг, в котором чувак оказывается в городской части города и расстреливает кучу полицейских - очень спорное решение с геймдизайнерской точки зрения, все-таки все (основная часть) полицейские обладают огнестрелом и увернуться от выстрела на открытой местности не получается, а при движении из-за здания\обьекта, его границы слишком расплывчаты для того, чтобы можно было прикинуть триггер-тайминг врага. Pre-fire, твой выход! 

В остальном, даже в GTA играх дебош против полицейских ощущается куда азартнее, чем здесь. А так, если вы все же не преследуете виртуальный геноцид, исповедуемый этими разработчиками в серии Postal и жаждете настоящей шутерной динамики, лучше обратить свое внимание на Crimsonland подобные игры. Переиздание хорошее, игра - нет.

33364603.review:
POSTAL Redux, released in 2016, is a remaster of the original POSTAL 1, released in 1997. Again, you play as the Postal Dude as he kills everyone in his way leading up to the Air Force Base.

There's really not much to say. If you want more information, read up on my POSTAL 1 review. However, there are a couple new features and levels that make it so much better than the original. Mouse aiming, reticle that indicates enemy health, and Super POSTAL levels and Super Diverly made it in, including Osaka, Tokyo, Earthquake, Shanty Town, and a couple others.

Overall, POSTAL Redux makes the original POSTAL experience a lot better and it's still a great dark isometric shooter. I'd give this version of POSTAL a 8/10.

33319792.review:
If you've played the original POSTAL you know what you're in for. It's the same game but with a nicer coat of paint and more responsive controls + controller support which is always a plus for me because I do love my XBOX 360 controller. 

For those who have no idea what POSTAL is, it is basically a killing spree simulator. Nothing more, nothing less. Your only objective in every level is to kill the required amount of people to open the exit. You have a lot of weapons to choose from and the can bring a nice variety to the gameplay but the truth is that consider the weapons, the game has a major flaw. This is a flaw you can find in most older games. The default weapon(in this case a sub-machine gun) has unlimited ammo. That leads to, more often than not, relying on this weapon to spam fire on the general direction of your enemies to clear the level. I mean, it must be a good way out for some people and I've used it that way quite some times but the truth of the matter is that it makes the game a little too easy. 

Other than that, the game has an isometric camera so it's a bit like playing GTA 2 with an original Fallout camera. The updated graphics are easy on the eyes and I didn't encounter any problems with the camera whatsoever. I would say it suits the game 'cause it allows you to have a general view of the carnage you caused and it will never make the experience harder than it should be. 

Overall, it is a good game to unwind after a long day in the office where you already think about murdering everyone on sight. If you find it too old timey or clunky for your taste, you can ignore it and go straight to its spiritual successor Hatred.

33178725.review:
4.2.1

[b]A remake of Postal in UE4, supposedly remade from scratch that may be a little too faithful to the original. Along with the good comes some of the same issues the classic had.[/b]
Redux comes with multiplayer deathmatch/co-op, the classic campaign along with their expansion levels, and the new single player mode, Rampage, where an actual scoring system comes to play.

The controls in Redux are far more superior to the classic tank controls, but the game's nice enough to add tank controls anyway if you so wish to play it that way. You can now run and shoot with better precision and it plays more like an actual twin stick shooter with full controller compatibility. The game is much lower in difficulty compared to the classic thanks to the ability to properly run & gun.
Practically every action is rebind-able for both controller and KB+M; even the controller settings have a small array of specific settings for it, though I'm afraid I don't understand what half of those mean. It's only a little more optimal to use KB+M since you can switch weapons faster there and aiming with a mouse makes targeting easier.

Music is non-existent throughout the campaign so you're kind of encouraged to play your own (in)appropriate songs whilst going postal.

Just like the classic, the only objective is to simply run around the current level and kill enough hostiles to pogress to the next level. In Redux, you only need to reach a certain high percentage of dead hostiles to progress to the next level; anyone else remaining becomes optional.
There are no checkpoints throughout the entire game and the only one that exists is the auto save file in the regular campaign right as a level starts so you're forced to restart the entire level if you die. 

The regular campaign is just a basic "kill this many hostiles to progress" deal. The lower the difficulty you select, the more mindless the game becomes since enemies won't hit hard, there are less of them on the map, and etc. etc. You can breeze through all the levels in under an hour on Easy mode without much worry on dying. On higher difficulties you're forced to be more cautious and efficient with your weapons. Fancy enough, ammo is always in abundance if you know how & when to use the right weapons, regardless of the difficulty setting.
For whatever reason, there's no level select option in the regular campaign and there aren't enough save slots for all the levels if you decide to save a level per slot. You can start the campaign from the very beginning with or without the expansion, or just begin the expansion by itself. True level selecting is only available through the multiplayer stuff and Rampage.

Rampage is designed to be a  new game mode using the same base maps where you're strongly encouraged to get a high rank based on your score. There are enough weapons & ammo in each level to get you the highest rank per map. You can get through all the levels to get the Rampage ending without worrying about the rank at all but then the point would be missed. Rampage is much faster paced compared to the other game modes due to the various ways you're scored, such as switching up what you kill with and how fast you can kill everyone. The rocking, fast-paced music that comes along with it accentuates the entire mood of Rampage.
Depending on the map, scoring is either very strict, very forgiving, or somewhere in between due to how the levels were originally designed so it won't necessarily get harder the further you progress in Rampage. There's no difficulty setting for this mode either anyway. Getting the highest rank means having to replay levels over & over again (usually) if you're not lucky enough to get an A+ on the first try.

Multiplayer mode is now a feature in this remake but there aren't usually anyone playing so it's pretty unreliable to find someone to play with in-game. I haven't tried the deathmatch but the co-op, which is just the regular campaign plus the expansion levels on a high difficulty, can be pretty fun with others. Unfortunately, there are no breaks between level transitioning; you move on immediately without wait when a level's done, no one respawns until everyone dies or beats the level, and all weapons & ammo acquired are always reset when you exit the current play session. You can play the co-op mode alone or with clown bots to get the co-op ending if you have no one to play with.

Hard to say if there's even a story in this game, but if there is any, it's interesting to say the least although it's not very big and they're told through the loading screens as small diary/journal entries. If that's all the case, then the regular campaign, Rampage, and the co-op mode actually have their own story being told through their respective loading screens & endings.

The graphics in-game are a bit too cartoon-y for my taste and that's probably a result of the "high definition" thing cleaning the graphics up. The art for the loading screens and endings though are still pretty metal.

As earlier mentioned, the game may have been too faithful to the original, bringing in the good as well as the bad.
All the maps are once again just pre-rendered images and the only things 3D are the character models. Maps end up having very confusing playable layouts. 
It's still hard to tell what you can and can't walk on or shoot through half the time in way too many areas, and some things collide with your gunfire where they shouldn't. Some walls are apparently not walls at all and seemingly thin objects are wider than they appear. I've had a few instances where enemies shot through certain walls to hit me.
Unless you're in a clearly open area, it can become extremely dangerous for you to throw a molly or fire a rocket because they have too high a chance of colliding with what they shouldn't in a "realistic" environment. Even shooting at enemies sometimes doesn't get their hitboxes due to the different kinds of isometric perspectives in each map, even despite the crosshair being targeted directly at them. This especially goes with fire-based weapons regardless of them clearly being in the middle of the fire.
None, if not most, of these issues would likely exist had the entire environment at least be in 3D with a 2D feel or somewhere along the lines.

The developers seem to have a lot of respect for Hatred. Through a small cheat, you can unlock Hatred's own Antagonist as a character skin. He's fully voiced and is somehow more detailed than the Postal Dude in a manner of speaking. You can even make the game's color scheme look like Hatred's through the video options.

The game's supposed to be very dark in theme but the cartoon-y in-game graphics and a lot of the silly voice acting from the NPCs throughout the game make it lighter than it looks, with the expansion levels being the lightest.
Redux has its share of bugs and issues but it sets out to do what it does successfully, be a simple game about going postal. The price for it drops very low occasionally, too.

32392033.review:
В далёком 1997-ом году вышла в свет первая часть легендарной серии Postal. Игра в те времена оказалась действительно уникальной: вид от третьего лица, обилие оружия и бессмысленного насилия, а также агрессивная маркетинговая кампания, вызвавшая негодование почтовой службы США. Помимо этого, команда Running with Scissors разрабатывала игру на собственные средства, не привлекая никаких инвесторов. Несмотря на смешанные отзывы критиков, первый Postal привлёк достаточно внимания, собрав внушительную фанатскую базу.

На волне неожиданного успеха игры Running with Scissors продолжила развиваться в прежнем направлении, создав целую линейку шутеров Postal. Последним проектом студии стал ремейк первой части игры на современном движке Unreal Engine 4 – Postal: Redux.

В сюжетном плане ничего не изменилось. Главный герой, обозлённый на весь мир, выходит в собственный крестовый поход, расстреливая всё живое на пути. Противостоят ему полиция, спецназ, военные и агрессивно настроенные обыватели. В качестве мишеней в игре присутствуют также мирные жители, автоматические турели и… страусы. Последние, кстати, нередко появляются в самых неожиданных местах.

Геймплей, в принципе, остался тем же. Важным нововведением стала возможность самостоятельно настроить управление. Кроме того, Postal: Redux поддерживает возможность играть с геймпада, что многие геймеры сочтут весьма удобным. Впрочем, управление с помощью клавиатуры и мыши также не вызывает никаких проблем. Простая и интуитивно понятная механика игры не требует много времени на освоение.

Кардинальным изменениям подверглась графическая составляющая. Разработчики перевели свой первый проект на современный движок Unreal Engine 4, заново отрисовав всю визуализацию. При этом оригинальная психоделическая атмосфера не была нарушена. Выйдя в таком виде в 1997 году, проект произвел бы настоящий фурор. Да и на фоне современного игропрома графика в Postal: Redux выглядит вполне сносно.

Фоновая музыка не отвлекает от процесса уничтожения противников. Сигнатурой Postal стали выкрики главного героя и его противников и жертв – все они были сохранены в переиздании. Впрочем, сегодня ничто из перечисленного не вызывает восторга – аудиооформление выглядит уместным, но не более того.

Разработчики Postal делали одну из ставок на атмосферность проекта. Психическое расстройство главного героя подчёркивается мрачным оформлением игрового мира. Также стоит в очередной раз сослаться на сюжет происходящих событий: его нет. Борьба против полчищ врагов лишена всякого смысла, по крайней мере для игрока. Не возникает никаких сомнений в том, что главный герой «Going Postal» – лишился всяческого рассудка. А отвечать за это приходится жестокому (в прямом смысле) миру, который и довёл главного героя до такого состояния.

В 1997 году Postal набрала популярность и стала отправной точкой для студии Running with Scissors, выпустившей в свет следующие части серии. Но даже тогда критики отнеслись к игре с недоверием. К сожалению, причины для недовольства даёт и обновлённая Postal: Redux.

Множество претензий имеется к геймплейной составляющей проекта. С первых минут бросается в глаза непонятная система укрытий. Увы, достаточно качественная прорисовка не гарантировала правильное расположение хитбоксов, и даже спустя некоторое время в игре тяжело найти безопасный угол обстрела. Также разработчики не учли, что на смену громоздким «квадратам» пришли современные прямоугольные мониторы. Поэтому очень часто враги нападают на героя, находясь за пределами физически возможной видимости.

Разработчики не оставят работу над Postal: Redux после её релиза. Возможно, в будущем обновления отшлифуют игру, исправив недочёты. Но если механику можно довести до ума, то самый главный недостаток игры устранить невозможно.

В целом, геймплей представляется довольно скучным. Проект недостаточно лёгкий, чтобы сломя голову нестись на врагов и уничтожать их – не подходит на роль «груши» для снятия стресса. Геймплей недостаточно динамичен, чтобы затягивать на длительное время – плохой «таймкиллер». Серьёзно же воспринимать новый «Постал» не получается; в принципе, на это разработчики и не рассчитывали.

Полюбившаяся тысячам фанатам по всему миру серия Postal продолжается. К сожалению, достаточно бесславно. Бурно развивающаяся индустрия видеоигр установила высокую планку даже для инди-проектов. Безнадёжно застряв в прошлом веке, игра Postal: Redux просто не вписывается в современные представления об изометрическом шутере. Ей не найдётся иного места, кроме как на полке у коллекционера.

32157338.review:
Вобщем, сыграл я в POSTAL Redux. И что же я могу сказать... она средняя "на любителя".
Redux мне понравился и сделан он неплохо, но давайте разберёмся в наших любимых "+" и "-" этой игры.
ПЛЮСЫ:
1. Графика. ДА-ДА, в игре не такая уж и фотореалистичная графика, но просто посмотрите на 1 часть и на Redux.
2. Музыка. Незнаю как другим, но лично мне нравится драйвовая музыка в этой игре (я про Rampage).
3. Новинки. Очень был рад увидеть в игре Токио и Осаку ( узнаем, во что играли японцы и постреляем в японских школьниц( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ) Добавили ИМБО-Магнум, который убивает с одного или двух выстрелов (смотря какой противник) и добавили анимации добивания и самоубийства к другим оружиям (в 1 POSTAL всё делалось только с М16).
4. Звук. Стал более качественным, поэтому можете не убавлять звук перед игрой на 1% (в 1 части был жесткий пиздец со звуком, поэтому каждый раз когда вы кидали молотов в "76 тромбонистов" тооо... вашим ушам был пиздец.)
5. Управление. Наконец-то стало удобным и можно не тратить попусту патроны.
6. Дизайн. Если в 1 части были одни и те же модельки людей (изменения были конечно, но мелкие), то теперь у нас есть: военные, спецназ, клоуны (про японскую версию, были там разные модели или нет, я не знаю, поэтому я промолчу). Уровни неплохо нарисованы и теперь загрузочые экраны стали более качественными.
7. Ну и идея того что нужно было сделать ремастеред 1 части, чтобы показать сейчашним геймерам (которые слышали ТОЛЬКО ПРО 2 ЧАСТЬ!!!), как выглядел 1 POSTAL "ЭТО КЛАССИКА БЛЯТЬ! ЭТО ЗНАТЬ НАДО!"
МИНУСЫ:
1. Огонь. Огонь в этой игре бесполезен, как и мины. Бывает иногда так, что сколько не поджигай противника он всё равно не будет гореть (да-да напалм, это я про тебя.)
2. Некоторые проблемы. В начале были ОЧЕНЬ ДОЛГИЕ ЗАГРУЗОЧНЫЕ ЭКРАНЫ. Теперь у нас проблемы с производительностью и прицелом. С производительностью я разобрался, а вот с прицелом нет. Прицел резко поворачивается и я не могу нормально стрелять (но это походу опять проблема с AIMом и консолями).
3. Не в то время. Сейчас, любителей таких шутеров очень мало. Это как с Titanfall 2, против Redux и POSTAL 2, и сейчашнее время в которое вышло много шутеров С СЮЖИТОМ И ХРАФЕНОМ ЫЫЫ. Поэтому она будет легко забыта как и 1 часть, про которую вспомнит очень маленькое кол-во людей.
4. ИИ. ИИ в этой игре ОЧЕНЬ ТУПОЙ. Пока не подойдёшь очень близко, он тебя вообще не заметит (правда, он может иногда услышать выстрел и побежать к тебе).
5. Бесполезность пушек. Вот здесь мы снова встречаем момент когда в игре добавят охуеть сколько пушек и они будут бесполезны. Можно пройти только с двухстволкой или ещё хлеще... с M16. Могли бы придумать что-то.
ИТОГ:
Игра может понравиться не всем. Но это всё равно хороший ремастеред 1 части.
8 сгоревших страусов/10

31890036.review:
Well, shoot, how does someone start a review for a game that is as controversial today as when it came out? Bad distasteful puns aside, I’m sure one of my friends has questioned my morals or thinks of me an edge-lord by simply playing the game.

What was simple curiosity about playing POSTAL in 2017 led me into an introspection at the usage of violence in games, the importance of context, and the utter hypocrisy inherent in games that showed me that you shouldn’t play PR because it’s a game but more so because what you’re playing is a work of art.

[h1]One Man’s Death, Tragedy; A Million, Statistics[/h1]

At the risk of sounding callous, I felt no remorse from this game. There are various reasons as to why in gameplay terms, but I think I should debunk a few concerns. 

No, there is no correlation between violence in games and real-life. There are numerous studies to show that if there is any correlation, which is direct correlation fallacy, it is the exact opposite; games purge violence thoughts through exaggerated violence. This is not a sign of being desensitized but recognizing the utter absurdity in the violence, which is why as a squeamish person I did not feel bad. POSTAL also has zero sense of immersion or premeditation like in Hitman or Manhunt, so the violence is more a form of Catharism in the moment.

In gameplay terms, there are various aspects that remove empathy you may have when playing. The first of which are enemies that do fire back, which include cops, military personnel, miners with explosives, and turrets. Compared to Hatred, your enemies are more comical and “video-gamey” that helps with the campy nature rather than emphasize how serious it is. Second, the AI is stupid, especially for the civilians, so the utter lemming-like attitude takes away any remorse. Lastly, the mundane nature  of killing 90% of HOSTILES (not civilians) emphasizes you to be more creative in your kills to find any semblance of entertainment.

Ultimately, however, whatever interest you may find in setting fire to a marching band or at an elderly home becomes hollow and death becomes meaningless, which goes to show the difference between mindless violence and violence with a purpose. 

[h1]Death Be Thy Context[/h1]

The fundamental issue, a topic not a fault, is that The Postal Dude is epitomizes the death of context. Context is the circumstances surrounding the event that emphasizes its relevance. This is why when you start off by massacring a neighborhood it sounds horrible; whereas when you are playing it for yourself you might as well be shooting at aliens or zombies. 

Everything about TPD is a rejection of context. For starters, his name itself is someone who has had enough and goes on a rampage. However, in many games that play with as much violence, there is usually a reason behind the motive as an excuse. While there is a backstory to give little, if any, context to TPD, the only thing you experience when you play is a needless rampage killing in Campaign-Mode. The only reason you kill is because the objective marker tells you to kill 90% of enemies, and there are achievements to not kill any civilian or to kill everyone. Only in the newly featured Rampage Mode is there a score-modifier, which goes to show how utterly devoid of meaning is in the base game itself. The ending is the only time the game seeks to find retribution for its existence by classifying TPD as the byproduct of modernity. 

The problem with PR as a game is that many games have features that accomplish the same thing or there are games that explore violence with more purpose. Spec Ops: The Line and Undertale—two games I never thought to share the same sentence—explore the consequences of choice in gameplay and story. In terms of raw gameplay, Hitman and Manhunt explore the same dubious nature of violence, and any recent Grand Theft Auto game lets you play with friends to accomplish the same goal of mindless violence. The reason why these games are more effective at dealing with these issues is the first victim in POSTAL’s slaughter, context. 

POSTAL is the only game I can think of where the death of context was the point of the game, and the purpose of eliminating all context was to showcase the hypocrisy in games.

[h1]“Everybody Is A Phony”[/h1]

Back when POSTAL originally came out, almost every character in video games was some form of a heroic characters with redeemable qualities. Upon its release, POSTAL solidified the existence of antiheroes in games. Even to this day, I couldn’t find someone more deplorable than TPD without the purpose to be comically evil (Overlord) or to make evil a topic to explore for the sake of storytelling (Tyranny).  

What makes TPD redeemable as a character is solely because his existence points to a hypocrisy in games that showcases how violence is used and justified. The fact that you could replace the violence with any other character or replace the enemies into other conventional excuses would be mere interpretation if it wasn’t for the original POSTAL ending. After massacring thousands of people, the Postal Dude arrives at an elementary school. When you try to play the game, you will find that none of your weapons work and the Postal Dude cannot kill any kids before he gives into insanity. Why? It’s because it’s a video-game and M-rated games cannot let you kill them. 

This taboo in games is still prevalent, and more strongly barred, in games like Skyrim where children are immortal or in the case of Metal Gear Solid 5 they put a fail-state on their deaths. The fact that the original ended this way to poke fun at the trope emphasizes how TPD was meant to be commentary of how games use violence without equity. 

However, I’ve talked only about the original; the Redux changed it and offered three replacements. As you can imagine a lot has changed between 1997 and 2017, and I cannot fault the developers for feeling that the original ending would have been more distasteful today as they explained why they changed it. Unfortunately, none of them reach the meta-commentary heights of the original and only offer fan-service for TPD, and the result is that even PR is an addition to the commentary of how hypocritical games are today from how they once were before.

As painful or distasteful as the idea may be, I think taking out that ending was not for the better. This situation reminds me of something Holden Caulfield once said, “Certain things, they should stay the way they are. You ought to be able to stick them in one of those big glass cases and just leave them alone.” 

[h1]Artsy Smartsy Nonsense[/h1]

You might be wondering why I have only glossed over the gameplay and features. It’s because if you want to play the game itself there are vastly better alternatives that do everything POSTAL sets out to do better, and even the sequels, as shoddy as they are as games, offer more to gain from the gameplay itself. 

The reason why I deliberately opened this up into an artsy-fartsy critique is because I think the people that enjoy Chinese Room games would appreciate POSTAL more so than edgelords or people who enjoy dark-humor. (As underhanded as that comparison was to Chinese Room, at least POSTAL offers more of a game.)

All I need to say about the actual gameplay itself is it does what it is meant to do. The extra levels add some needed comedic value to the game and the additional modes such as Coop and Rampage add some longevity or purpose. Some may decry the censorship as a reason to not buy the Redux; however, the original is still available, and this verison offers something more playable to modern gamers.

Perhaps you may think that this critique was from buyer’s remorse or a pointless endeavor to justify this game’s existence as historical shock value. All I have to say in response is you can mail your complaints to the nearest post office and pass along the message,

*Puts sunglasses on*

“Going Postal.”

31886829.review:
[b]Postal was a cult and controversial game released in the 90ies. [/b]
The controversy spins around the fact that in the game you play the role of a mad man, known only as “postal dude”, who basically goes into a rampage, killing everyone around him based only on his own delirious ideas of “purifying the Earth” or something. Another controversy is that the game hints a few references to some macabre school shootings that happend by the time of the game’s release in the 90ies.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The game is an isometric shooter, where you move your character around the evironment while trying to aim and shoot everyone on sight. Scattered around the corners you will find new weapons, ammo and a few power ups that will help you in your journey of insane murder. You will be running around towns, parks and a other populated areas, all filled with random “innocent” people and also hostile ones, like cops, rangers, soldiers and other agents of the law trying to stop you. Kill 90% of the hostiles and you can move to the next level.

[h1]Redux version[/h1]

This version has a LOT of improvements to add, starting with the controls, which are much, much better now. The combination mouse+keyboard has now a very fluid gameplay, with resposive controls, unlike the 90ies version, where controls were clunky AF. Also, all the DLCs were added and a few more singleplayer modes were add too, making the game much larger and potentially replayable. There are also a few easter eggs, like some references and modes related to other games, such as Hatred and Such.

[b]I Rate it 4.8/5.0[/b]

31519421.review:
after i'm done with the wonderful postal 2 package of the rws i finally got my hands on the postal redux. as a person who actually played the original postal back in the day, i cannot say i had the best of time playing it, it was an average endeavour with an "original" premise, playing a mass shooting maniac was both controversial and refreshing and for a person who is not offended by every other thing that's been thrown on his way, it was a nice idea, but the game itself was not great, especially the controls were a big part of the problem plus for me the lack of a comprehensive story was a huge red flag. but on the other hand the hand drawn graphics and some insanely clever ideas here and there ( "the marching band" is a wonderful example) and the dark, mysterious core material turned this into a welcoming experience for me.


and now with the redux we have the definitive remastered edition of this hiccup of a game, do i recommend it? well... i'm sort of not sure. don't get me wrong the game is great if you're the fan of the series. with added content (even the famous super postal episodes are here) improved graphics and most importantly "much better controls" this game is and should be a "must". and i can't wrong the game in any of those areas but, since the controls are better now, the game is very, i mean VERY easy. and you can beat it in 2 hours if you just try to speedrun it ( even less than 2 hours if you're better than me at playing games - and you are-). the game offers multiplayer, co-op and rampage modes, which are huge additions but i cannot find anyone online for two of these modes and the rampage mode is not my cup of tea since i'm a linear campaign person. the rampage mode only did the trick for me for an hour or so. afterwards the only choice for me was to uninstall the game.



all in all, this is an improvement over postal original on every fucking level and the definitive version of the game. if you're going to buy a postal game, start with this game, if you want a twin stick shooter with a darker edge buy this game, if you see this game on the sale ( but only on the sale) buy this game. i can recommend postal 2 and the wonderful add on even if they're not on sale, but this one, imho is an exclusively "sale" material because it will keep you occupied only for couple of hours but let's be honest you will enjoy the hell out of those "couple of hours".



note: and yes, i know rws is still improving the loading times, but i think they still need some improvement.

31513930.review:
Hra Postal je bezesporu kultem. Dílo šílených Američanů z Running With Scissors se stalo všeobecně známé díky svému nezměrnému násilí podávaném naplno a bez servítků. Jednoduchou izometrickou střílečku, ve které protagonistu chytne amok, aby vyvraždil nejen své protivníky, ale i nevinné kolemjdoucí, budete buď milovat nebo nenávidět. 

Jelikož se ve hrách kontroverze nebojím, hru Postal považuji za zdařilou akční hru vyšperkovanou dokonalým ztvárněním atmosféry smrti a zmaru v ulicích. Zážitek z líté řeže mi naneštěstí kalilo nemotorné ovládání, které místo zběsilého řádění, jež by se v případě tohoto titulu právem nabízelo, nutilo hráče zpomalit a nepřátele likvidovat s opatrností a po jednom. 

Postal Redux je aktualizovanou a přepracovanou verzí hry. Nabízí vylepšenou a poctivě přepracovanou originální ručně malovanou grafiku z originální verze a předkládá ji ve vysokém rozlišení v kombinaci s vylepšenými modely nepřátel. To vše na spolehlivém Unreal enginu. K dispozici je nejen originální kampaň, ale i levely z datadisku. Můžete je hrát odděleně, ale já jsem dal přednost kampani Excess Postage spojující všechny dostupné úrovně v jeden velký masakr. 

Přepracovaný Postal šlape jako hodinky a hra je opravdu rychlá a plynulá s využitím ovládání na klávesnici v kombinací s myší. A přesně tak se měl originál hrát. Zábavné a pestré prostředí kombinující uzavřenější lokace s širokými otevřenými plochami, přesná a zběsilá akce, atmosféra masového vraždění s výkřiky protivníků i umírajících. Bohatá kolekce smrtících zbraní. Férová obtížnost umožňující pohodlný a plynulý postup. Na druhou stranu nemožnost ukládání během mise, což vyžaduje přece jen určitou opatrnost při hře. Rychlý průběh s sebou nese určitou krátkost kampaně, která se dá dohrát zhruba za 2.5-3 hodiny, ale speed runneři hru zvládnou i pod 30 minut, což je zároveň jedním z achievementů. 

Achievementy dodávají hře to správné koření a poskytují motivaci zahrát si kampaň znovu. Můžete volit nejenom styl genocidní, kdy musíte zabít vše co se hýbá v levelu, ale také relativně pacifistický přístup, kdy musíte ušetřit životy nevinných kolemjdoucích, kteří se všude kolem motají. Odměny dostáváte i za splnění jistých specifických úkolů, kupříkladu upálení hudebního orchestru, likvidace protestantů proti vývojářům nebo také zabití všech pštrosů v mapě. Nic pro slabé povahy. 

Fanouškům instantního zabíjení je rovněž k disposici mód Rampage, jehož cílem je dosažení maximálního skóre rychlou a efektivní likvidací soupeřů s pokud možno co největším počtem zabitých v rychlém sledu. A taky kooperativní online multiplayer. Zde jsem však neuspěl, neboť systém mi spolupracovníka nenašel. Musel bych si asi založit server. 

Postal Redux mi poskytl notnou dávku pravdy a lásky v předvečer svátku 1. Máje. Dokonalá satisfakce z rychlé akce mi umožnila relaxaci a výborný zážitek, který původní hru strká s přehledem do kapsy. A nabízí se srovnání s následovníkem Hatred od podobně “postiženého” polského studia Destructive Creations, a i zde u mě zvítězil remake originálu. A ještě perlička na závěr - za polského metalového maniaka si můžete zahrát po drobné úpravě i v Postalu. 

Hodnocení: 95%

Вообщем ремастеру я могу поставить твердую 8\10, так как они сделали шикарный ремейк классики, но убрали то что делало его таким криповым хоррором.

Enter this game, not only an improvement on gameplay on every level but visually as well. But there are some flaws. You now have wasd movement, a crosshair, can change the color of your coat (theres one that makes you Not Important from hatred but I couldnt figure out how to make it work.)
Now for the flaws of the game:
This game crashes. Sometimes. Sometimes I can go through 2 or 3 levels without crashing, sometimes it boots up and crashes, and sometimes it doesn't crash at all.
Because of the new engine the framerate is a little unstable, but its much more stable than hatred, a game I will bring up again in this review.

Fair warning, if you played postal 2 this game is nothing like that.

30797469.review:
The original Postal while famous for it's controversial themes and gameplay had aged extremely poorly. Postal Redux, the new and improved remake of the first game is a much welcome suprise from Running with Scissors. The controls are far simpler and make the game playable in this modern era. Two new levels have been added along with all of the past bonus content added to the original. 

Other than this very little has changed. Everything is as you remember the original game to be, only with new, improved artwork and unfortunately a lot of the same issues. Level design is still a bit awkward and despite attempts to make the camera and traversing buildings work smoothly. It still becomes very hard to see what is in front of you and where your character is located in the urban levels.

Some people may want to avoid the high impact themes but mainly these devolve into teenage style angsty violence rather than something actually offensive. If you were interested in the original and found it too hard to play, or was already a fan, this is something you will enjoy.

30399402.review:
One of the more memorable features of 1993's Syndicate was lighting people on fire with your flamethrower. The little sprites would run around, arms flailing and screeching in agony until they crumbled into a pile of ash and bone. It was shockingly brutal and so unexpected that it was funny; I'm sure I wasn't the only player who purposely lit civilians on fire just to watch them dash about in their panicked death throes. Apparently the developers of Postal ("Running with Scissors") enjoyed this as much as I did, because they essentially made a game around this trope.

I never played Postal when it was first released in 1996. It was just one of many isometric shooters released around that time - the Crusader games, Gender Wars, SCUD Industrial Revolution, Bedlam - and its only apparent gimmick was that it was purposefully trying to be controversial (and it was successful too, garnering attention from Jack Thompson and the "video-games-are-evil" club). But it didn't seem to stand out in any way beyond that, so it was only until recently that I bought the game. 

As it turns out, my initial reactions were correct; this is a shallow game. On its most basic level, the shooting mechanics are acceptable; I point, I shoot, things die. This simplicity, however, is never backed up by anything else; the game lacks in graphics, interesting level design, good sound or music, AI, puzzles... even challenge. It's shooting is about as sophisticated as 1985's "Robotron", except without that seminal's game waves of enemies constantly charging towards you. It's fun for about five minutes, and then boredom quickly sets in. The shock-humor of the game - the aforementioned people on fire, the gut-shot victims crawling about begging for mercy - entertain for another few minutes before that too quickly becomes repetitive. In addition, the levels themselves are fairly short and you can waltz through the core game in a couple of hours (there are bonus levels, but they are just more of the same). It's a tiresome shooter far surpassed by almost any modern games and even most of its contemporaries.

29495402.review:
What can be said about postal that hasn't been already said before, i was curious to see how a 1997 game could be remade for today's gaming atmosphere , I loved the original postal game and played it back then on a Pentium 2 pc , So after playing Postal Redux i can honestly say its worth the money, for new players of the series, But for the older players it's a sticky deal only purchase affair. I think a lot could be focused on making the in game experience better than just the graphics.

Note : i will not be covering the co-op / online/ rampage  modes , never a fan of those modes. I dont think this classic needs those modes either. When the game name already says postal.

Here are my Pros and cons on the game.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- New levels, the  Excess Postage campaign of 23 levels is amazing  playing those 23 levels alone in one go is enough to make you go postal and understand why this series is a hit with many fans.

- The graphics are updated and its much more easier on the eyes now. Good visuals and effects.

- Co-op mode , should be fun although i stayed away from it due to the bad pings i get<regional issue not the game>

- They have added neat retro stuff like filters you can try em out to ruin your eyesight.

- Retains the tank controls , love it.

[b]Cons:[/b]
- No improvements to the guns , i think the guns are much worse here in accuracy and range here than the original game, the flamethrower is practically useless since it gets blocked out by the objects, frequently, the machine gun replacement is way worse than the original gun. shotgun, pistol , rocket launcher are your only accurate options specially for non civilian kills. 

- Heavy system requirements , i think this will be a major turn off for the older fans who ran the original game on way older systems that this game demands minimum of 8gb ram.
The devs have explained the requirement here do be wary of it http://steamcommunity.com/app/401680/discussions/0/152393186493151563/?ctp=6#c141136086911895129

-Long initial loading time this has been major turn off because in game like postal you tend run through the levels quickly and death is frequent visitor . I have never seen such a complex loading system in a game before to break it down.
- There is one loading screen when you select single player mode.
- There is one more longer loading screen ( it might take upto 5 minutes depending on your config)
- Between the levels there instant loading sometimes and a bit of loading later.
- If you die , expect another long loading screen to reload.

[b]RWS please please put a % or progress bars for the loading screens, so that people will know whats happening.[/b]

- Not sure how to put it but the new engine is not that smooth, although it ran great for me most of the times , there was a lot of slowdowns and freezes in various parts. i hate to imagine how this would be in the multiplayer/co-op modes.

- [b]Maybe i did not pay any attention to the loading screens before the level starts or something but the original ending has been changed and i have no idea what the new one means...the older one made sense to the madness but the current one meh...[/b] , i guess its the PG era we live in now.

[b]Final Thoughts :[/b] It was a sting of nostalgia playing postal again in the modern redux, But i would jump into the original game any day , it just shows how complex gaming has become today just grab the original and play it and see the difference. It is just so much easier and fun to get in and play.
Knowing how good RWS are with the fans and supporting their game releases , i expect them to smooth out the game even more and fix the issues. Smooth gameplay should be the focus of the game over other things, that fast and easy gameplay is what made the original a classic.

Hoping for a good sequel to postal 2 , the other one must not be mentioned.

The game is easily a 6.5/10 , would have been my favorite postal game  if the game was easy on the hardware requirements, which would have allowed many of the casual gamers with entry level hardware to play it.
