29305524.review:
Postal Redux foi desenvolvido pela Running With Scissors que todo mundo conhece devido a Postal 2 (que não gostei) e o Postal clássico. Que nesta versão Redux ficou uma maravilha.

Postal Redux é um game de ação e de pura, pura violência explícita. Aqui nós não encontramos enredo mas apenas frases ditas pelo protagonista sobre pessoas, mortes, suas crenças e até mesmo frases mais bizarras como queimar todos, matar todos e não sobrar nenhum, ou algum lugar perfeito para matar todo mundo. Os personagens do jogo são variados, temos as pessoas normais, policiais, Swat, civis revoltados que atiram granadas e até mesmo os militares. Todos fazem parte do jogo e temos os inimigos mais fortes e mais fracos, óbviamente. O legal do jogo é que a proposta dele é pura diversão. É só sair matando todos os personagens que acabam saindo gritando como loucos e até mesmo temos varias formas de matar os mesmos, como um arsenal de armas bem grandes, incluindo: Rifles, Lança chamas, Escopeta, molotov's, granadas, rifles de maior potência, bazucas e pistolas. O arsenal é grande e as maneiras de matar também. Podemos atirar em postos de gasolina e tocar o maior terror queimando todo mundo que está em volta ou até mesmo em barris de gasolina. O legal disso tudo é ver as pessoas correndo desesperadas enquanto as forças militares e policias já avançam tentando te matar. O destaque fica por conta das frases ditas pelo protagonista que são sensacionais e com um humor negro refinado. Quando matamos algum personagem e o mesmo resiste, tu pode executar ele e geralmente ele implora pela vida dele e o nosso querido protagonista "Postal Dude" só diz: Goodbye, hahahahahah. Sendo as outras milhares de frases ditas por ele e também pelos personagens dos jogo: "Por favor, não me mate" e por ai vai.

É um jogo pesado e recomendado apenas para adultos.

Sobre o enredo ele é fraco, apenas com frases como citei anteriormente, durante os loadings e também com um pequeno twist no final do enredo, que acaba brincando entre o hilário e o literalmente pesado. Já que tem um pequeno twist no final. E eu pensando que acabaria enfrentando um chefe ou algo do tipo, no final ... o meu destino foi outro. 

Tirando esta parte do jogo, quem jogou o clássico sabe que aquela tal missão polêmica foi retirada, o quê eu acho bom já que não fica apelativo demais ou melhor: Mais do que já é.

A trilha sonora é boa e a mistura de gritos com a trilha sonora pesada é sensacional. 

Os gráficos estão muito bonitos, as texturas, o jogo de sombras, os personagens e principalmente as missões. Todas são bastante variadas e algumas se destacam como por exemplo: Resort, o parque, o super mercado. Que são as mais bonitas na minha opinião. O jogo não tem gráficos sensacionais, mas a ambientação fala por sí só. Foi realmente um trabalho ótimo da desenvolvedora do jogo.

O jogo também tem cooperativo (apesar de não ter quase ninguém pra jogar) e também Deathmatch podendo assim enfrentar outros jogadores. A conexão é ruim e o ping é alto. É um ponto a se levar em consideração. Também é raro encontrar alguém para jogar cooperativo. Eu não joguei nenhum dos modos porque meu foco era unicamente o modo campanha duplo com todas as missões incluídas no pacote. Também temos o modo rampage que são as mesmas missões só que com uma dificuldade maior, tentando fazer o maior número de mortes e o melhor score possível. Algo que pode agradar alguns, a mim não agradou já que o jogo tem poucas missões e vai se tornar repetitivo jogar tudo novamente apenas por matar e pegar score, mas tem quem goste.

Vamos analisar de forma simples os pontos positivos e negativos de Postal Redux:

Pontos positivos: 

+ Formas de execução.
+ Formas de matar os personagens do jogo.
+ Boa quantidade de armas e outros equipamentos.
+ Conquistas para miletadores.
+ Cartas 
+ Ambientação e missões muito bonitas e variadas, incluindo um bom level design.
+ Varios níveis de dificuldade e modos de jogo.
+ Personagem com sacadas geniais e frases hilárias. 
+ Personagens também com frases marcantes. 
+ Trilha Sonora e som ambiente e das armas muito bem feito. 
+ Divertido e ótimo para jogar nos momentos de tédio.

Pontos negativos:

- Loadings extremamente demorados (a desenvolvedora lançou um patch que melhora, mas se tu acabar falhando na missão, senta e espera por até mais de 1 minuto até o jogo carregar novamente)
- O jogo é um consumidor de memória do computador, não entendo como pode ser possível.
- O jogo não tem muitas missões, ou seja é um jogo curto para quem apenas quem quer pegar e zerar a campanha principal que são ao total 23 missões. Pequenas e com dificuldade fácil no modo normal. (É claro que podemos aumentar o tempo de jogo no modo rampage que são as mesmas missões só para fazer score ou zerar o jogo no nível mais alto).
- Pobre de enredo: Para jogadores que procuram um jogo que mescla violência e enredo, aqui não está seu jogo.
- Preço absurdamente caro para quem for zerar apenas a campanha principal.
- Modo COOP e Deathmatch praticamente sem jogadores e com ping alto para brasileiros ou seja: tenha amigos para jogar ou pode sofrer com o ping alto + falta de jogadores.

No final das contas, Postal Redux foi uma versão melhorada do clássico jogo que praticamente todo mundo já ouviu falar. Ele funciona sem maiores problemas, é um jogo leve (tirando os loadings longos) é um jogo divertido, com frases hilárias e com violência ao extremo e uma ambientação e level design de tirar o folêgo. Sem contar a trilha sonora e o seu personagem "Postal Dude" que é o cara foda da história, até a missão final, hahahahahah.

O jogo costuma sair em sale entre 2 - 4 reais, ou seja ... perfeito para quem quer apenas se divertir tocando o terror e praticando o horror com os personagens em geral do jogo. É um jogo divertido, sem compromisso e sem maiores falhas.

Mas só recomendo o mesmo por ter comprado em sale e me divertido com ele. Se você tem amigos para jogar, quer miletar o jogo e jogar as mesmas missões novamente, ou jogar cooperativo ou até mesmo ficar fazendo score nas mesmas missões, o jogo pode valer o preço full. Mas lembrando: Esta parte do jogo está morta e para nós brasileiros o Ping é alto, eu testei e afirmo isso. 

Agora se você quer jogar a campanha e sair metralhando todo mundo e acompanhando o banho de sangue pelos cenários incríveis do jogo, ah meu amigo ... compre em sale e seja feliz!

Eu recomendo, Postal Redux. 

Com desconto!

29211027.review:
tldr: A bargain bin quality game even when it came out in 1997 that only gained cult status because of its extreme and controversial subject matter but was very fairly and accurately harshly judged by critics. Its even worse sequel and an unmentionably bad 3rd game don't help its case either. One of the worst game series I have ever seen and also one of the most undeserving of any praise or any attention period.

The devs fixed the startup load time which was insane, around 3-5 minutes, but the load times between levels is still way longer than it should be for such a small game. Even when you do get to play, it is just as bad as the original game. Take a look at the metacritic score of 53/100 and just know that even that low of a score is being very generous. Updating a bad game with WASD+mouse movement does not make it any better and this game is living proof of that. The only reason the original Postal got just enough fans to reach cult status and have a sequel was because of its over the top subject matter, that you are simply a dude who goes psychotic and starts killing everyone around him. It got mostly bad critic scores for a good reason, as critics were objective enough to see this game's numerous and egregious flaws. Its fans are too dumb to be objective enough to gauge this game for what it actually is: pure garbage. It just goes to show how bad a game can get away with being as long as it has enough shock value. It was never a good game and neither is this redux, and Postal 2 is even worse. Not to mention Postal 3 is widely regarded as one of the worst games of all time with some of the lowest scores I've ever seen critics give a game, and I know how bad it is because I've unfortunately tried it too.

Just a few of its big dumb flaws include:
One hit from a rocket turret didn't kill me, it took 3, but the problem is the first hit knocked me down and allowed for a second then 3rd hit before I could regain control. Enemies can hit you from off-screen too just before they become visible on the edge of the screen. Your guy takes too much damage making you always have to tip-toe around and be ultra careful. If you get caught on fire from a molotov, the game steals control from you and you always run screaming out in the open where the most gunfire is and get smashed from all directions. This version is just as gut wrenchingly ugly as it was back in 1997 and just as bargain bin quality bad.

You know what I could go on but who cares? The developers who made this game series sure didn't and the entire postal series is proof of that. 4/10 sucks in every area, still better than Postal 2, but most games are anyway without much effort.

29192690.review:
Фанатам Чикатило посвящается.
Перед нами ремейк первой части игры Postal. Симулятор сумасшедшего маньяка, который вооружившись стволами (в нашем распоряжении автомат, ружье, автоматический дробовик, ракетница, гранатомёт, огнемет, гранаты, мины, коктейли молотова) начинает охоту на живых (пытаются противостоять нам полиция, военные, спецназ, а также случайные прохожие и даже страусы).
Изометрическая графика 1997 года была подтянута, улучшены эффекты, текстуры, поддержка высокого разрешения и широкоформатных мониторов, объёмные модельки персонажей и так далее. Сравнивая скрины - игра заметно похорошела в 2016ом году благодаря её переносу на движок Unreal Engine 4. Честно говоря, можно было и лучше, но я полагаю, что главной задачей разработчиков было "воскресить" игру, дать ей второе дыхание, а не пересоздать её неузнаваемой фанатами.
Задача игрока состоит в том, что нужно уровень за уровнем "зачищать" местность от представителей власти, по пути сокращая популяцию прохожих, случайно оказавшихся под перекрестным огнём обеих сторон. Всё просто, уничтожили 90% врагов - добро пожаловать на следующий уровень (либо добей всех остальных). 
Никаких извращений с кучей тайников. Никакого мощного сюжета или морали. Никаких геймплейных плюшек. 
Простой кровавый беспредел. Игра замечательно подходит всем мизантропам, или людям, которым нужно излить накопившуюся агрессию на компьютерных болванчиков.

28885725.review:
La campagne se termine en à peu prés [b] 4h [/b] (La campagne en mode normal + la campagne bonus en mode normale en prenant bien soin de tuer tout le monde, forces de l'ordre comme "innocents" citoyens, et des autruches). Mais cette durée de vie est rallongeable avec la difficulté maximale et les autres modes de jeu.

[b] /!\ Les temps de chargements ne sont plus extrêment longs grâce au nouveau Patch 4.0, alors on peut le jouer sans attendre ! [/b]

[h1] Comparé au Postal Classique, Postal Redux offre : [/h1]
-Une maniabilité plus adéquate 
-Davantage de niveaux
-Des modèles 3D et des maps détaillés
-Une IA plus évoluée (plus difficile pour vous de venir à bout de vos opposants)
-Des écrans de chargement entre chaque niveau qui sont [u] animés [/u] (ça donne une illusion de profondeur de champ alors que l'image est en 2D) et bien plus détaillés (style psychotique et un peu flippant)
-Un mode rampage (avoir le plus de points possible) et un multijoueur

[h1] Comparé à Postal 2 : [/h1]
    Il n'y a pas l'humour délirant et noir de Postal 2, Postal Redux est plutôt sérieux. Dans ce jeu on incarne un psychotique parano qui pense que tout le monde dans la ville de Paradise a pété un câble à cause de quelque chose dans l'air, et seul lui, le Postal dude peut arrêter ce carnage sanguinaire car il est le seul immunisé.

28868246.review:
Prima d'iniziare la recensione devo avvisarvi che il gioco è veramente di cattivo gusto.

[b][u]Il gioco in questione contiene violenza gratuita[/u][/b], il cui scopo è solo uccidere le persone senza nessuna ragione (ok una ragione ci sarà, ma sarà spiegata solo nella "lore" del gioco), facendo letteralmente stragi di città, negozi, e così via.
Quindi per i "moralisti" sconsiglio l'acquisto del gioco.
Detto questo iniziamo la recensione

[u]Postal, a differenza del secondo capitolo, e molto più serio, più tetro, più cattivo.[/u]
Si tratta di uno sparatutto a visuale isometrica, per i tempi ben fatto e adesso... bhe diciamo che non è invecchiato molto bene.

Inizialmente ho giocato al primo Postal, che teneva dei comandi veramente scomodi con la tastiera, non ci si riusciva a giocare bene.
Avevo fatto i primi 5-6 livelli con Joystick, ma poi ho notato che tenevo nella liberia questa versione, la versione Redux.
Cavolo, ci sono tutti i dlc inclusi, comandi che adesso funzionano perfettamente sulla tastiera, e multiplayer online che funziona bene.

[b]Graficamente[/b] si può dire che hanno semplicemente ridisegnato le mappe.
Le mappe del primo Postal erano proprio disegnate a mano, quelle attuali invece sono leggermente più digitalizzate, alla fine si nota comunque la differenza e hanno lasciato le zone fedeli all'originale.

[b]Le novità introdotte ne hanno aggiunte parecchie:
-Una nuova arma (revolver)
-Aggiunto un livello nuovo (oltre ad aver messo tutti i dlc usciti)
-Aggiunto una nuova difficoltà con una diversa "Lore" (che era presente nel vecchio manuale del gioco originale)
-Aggiunta la modalità coop online
-Aggiunta modalità rampage (uccidere più persone nelle varie mappe in minor tempo possibile)

[u]Invece di contro?[/u]

I bot alleati per l'online sono intelligenti[/b], ma per qualche strano motivo, [u]una volta che finiscono le munizioni, se ne stanno fermi senza cercarne altri fino alla fine del livello.[/u]

[b]Il finale nuovo mi è piaciuto di meno di quello vecchio[/b] (non voglio spoilerare niente)

Consiglio? Come ho scritto prima dipende da che tipo di persona siete.

Se non ve ne frega un cazzo di ammazzare persone senza particolare motivo e riuscite a sopportare la violenza del gioco allora potrei consigliarvelo (magari a un prezzo inferiore).
A quelli un po' più suscettibili direi di starne alla larga, anche perché alla fine non vi perderete uno di quei giochi così belli

28660546.review:
POSTAL was cool, but the only problems were that it played like absolute garbage and controlled like it, too. I always liked the themes that underlay the original POSTAL, the disturbing transitions between levels marked with the diary entries and surreal imagery, either of abstract horror or of hazy, grisly violence. POSTAL was a journey into insanity, with some fun gameplay mixed in.

POSTAL Redux made it that much more fun, though. The game is actually legitimately fun now, controls well with keyboard and mouse (I've yet to try it with a gamepad), and has a nice sheen of polish while also staying true to that trademark goofiness characteristic of the first POSTAL, such as ducking underneath rockets to make them hit whoever might be behind you, or the Dude's gruesome but cheesy one-liners.

In a sentence? It's like Hatred, but actually good. It's like POSTAL, but better. There's also 4-player co-op if you want to Eric & Dylan through some challenge levels with a friend or three.

Overall, I'd recommend, especially if you grab it on a sale-the Winter Sale I bought this on knocked the price down to $1.43, and Running with Scissors loves to do these huge sales every time there's a Steam sale. 

So what are you waiting for?

28398599.review:
Like its namesake, Postal Redux features all of the original Postal levels and gameplay but on a new engine with loads of improvements. 

Gameplay-wise not a whole lot has changed. Rather than pressing the “next level” button you now run to the exit area for a stage after killing the requisite number of baddies. Controls are also improved significantly for gamepad and the overall “flow” of the game feels much smoother than the original. There are a few new weapons but I found the shotgun, missile, and flame weapons to be pretty much all you need to complete the game on nightmare difficulty.

The graphical overhaul has made for a much more enjoyable experience and little details like being able to tell different kinds of police and soldiers apart as well as what weapons they’re holding is a nice touch. Animations for all characters are also very fluid, contributing much to the improved flow mentioned earlier. The soundtrack that accompanies all of this is likewise also improved and things sound better than before.

The original Postal was a decent game with a few flaws here and there. Redux manages to pave over those flaws and present itself almost as if it were its own unique game. In fact it’s so much better and comprehensive than the original that you might as well just play this one instead, especially since the story is more or less the same.

28213140.review:
Postal Redux is a damn fine game. 

It may not have as interesting of a story as Postal 2, but it's gameplay is the true selling point. This game is fun, really fun. I honestly think I enjoy the gameplay here more than Postal 2, which is saying A LOT. It just feels so good to mow down enemies however you want, but in more of an old school arcade style than Postal 2. 

This game is a perfect remake in terms of feeling like the original, but BETTER in gameplay. The art in this game is also phenomenal. Not a modern art masterpiece or anything, but it is very appealing, with the 3D models on point, looking very nice. The backgrounds and art between levels is also very visually impressive. The best way to play this game is with a keyboard and mouse, so if you have no controller, it's more than fine. The sound is also very interesting, as you can hear both screams, and Rick Hunter himself. Rick Hunter does a good job as the Postal Dude once again, and delivers good lines. 

The best thing about Postal Redux is that you can tell the developers care A LOT about the player. Not only is this game cheap, but its sheer fun makes it worth a lot more than most, if not all modern generic shooters. This game is pretty cheap, and for it's price, it's well worth it. And rather than adding new levels in some cheap DLC, they put them in a free update. Running with Scissors has had DLC before, but it felt very justified, with Paradise Lost being basically Postal 3. 

I haven't tried multiplayer for Postal Redux yet, but I'm sure it's fun. One issue hardcore fans of Postal 2 may find is that you HAVE to kill people. In the original Postal 2, killing was pretty much optional. While it is incredibly fun here, it may rub certain fans the wrong way.

OVERALL: Postal Redux is a fun game that is simple, but still incredibly enjoyable. It's worth every penny it costs and then some. It delivers the definitive version of the severely overlooked Postal 1. If you haven't already, buy this game, and Postal 2 with the DLC. You won't regret it, these games are fun, and buying them gives Running with Scissors the funding TO MAKE A REAL POSTAL 3. Postal Redux is simply a blast. BUY IT NOW, IT'S ONLY 9 BUCKS! 

9/10

This is a dark and gritty twinstick shooter about a man losing his mind and going on a genocidal rampage.

The controls are easy to get the hang of in the first few levels, but if you're feeling nostalgic you can change back to the "lovely" tank controls of the first game.
The gameplay is very smooth but challanging, the levels are getting more and more difficult with each location, respectively reflecting where they're set (trying to kill everyone in an army base will be way more difficult than shooting your neighbourhood grannies and grandpas at the local mart for instance). The later levels are getting pretty difficult, well, nearly suddenly but it is a fucking awesome feeling to conquer the difficulty of them and come out on top... as a genocidal nutjob who's so edgy you can even cut yourself just by looking at him.

Overall, this game is a great experience for those who like some challange and don't get [TRIGGERED] by controversial topics and such.

27356859.review:
In [b]POSTAL Redux[/b] betrek je de legerkisten en trenchcoat van The Postal Dude, een doorsnee Amerikaan die compleet doorslaat op een koude oktoberdag en besluit een orgie van geweld te ontketenen. Gedreven door psychotische waanideeën moordt hij zich een pad door diverse locaties, uiteenlopend van een woonwagenkamp, de getto en een supermarkt tot een resort, het circus en de hoofdstad van Japan. Onderweg jaagt hij een ruim aanbod tegenstanders over de kling, waaronder een muziekkorps, nudisten, hippies, bejaarden, advocaten, struisvogels, en honderden politieagenten en militairen.

Zoals de titel suggereert is [b]POSTAL Redux[/b] een heruitgave van de originele [url=store.steampowered.com/app/232770]POSTAL[/url], echter met enkele sterke verbeteringen. Zo zijn de 20 levels van het originele spel en de 'Special Delivery' uitbreiding hertekend en samengevoegd met 2 exclusieve locaties uit de Japanse versie van POSTAL èn 2 geheel nieuwe levels, waarmee het totaal aantal levels op 24 komt. Naast de verbetering of zelfs vernieuwing van de karakter- en wapenmodellen en animaties zijn ook de dialoog, geluidseffecten en spelbesturing grondig aangepakt. Tenslotte zijn nieuwe spelmodi toegevoegd; een online coöperatieve 2-4 spelersmodus, en een 'Rampage' modus waarin je moordzuchtige creativiteit en doorzettingsvermogen op de proef word gesteld.

Ondanks het feit dat [b]POSTAL[/b] ondertussen zo'n 20 jaar oud is, is deze [b]Redux[/b] versie absoluut een aanrader voor hen die de charme van een klassiek spel in een nieuw jasje kunnen waarderen.

Но в целом играть стало лучше, играть стало веселее.

26484965.review:
For those unfamiliar with Postal 1, it is far different in tone and gameplay of the more known Postal 2. Postal 1 was a rudimentary isometric shooter in which you are placed in the shoes of a homicidal madman. You progress through levels by only really having to kill hostiles, though there is no penalty or reward for killing innocents as well. In-between loading screens you are given a brief vague description of the main characters current thoughts/views with hellish imagery and sounds. The game is mostly un-nerving with an occasional mix of dark humour. While the game originally was very basic, it's execution stuck with me as it's an interesting portrayal of a decent into madness. I really wanted to see where it all lead rather than experience the actual gameplay.  

Seeing Postal Redux on sale for $2.50 got me excited to experience this game in a new way and I'm happy to say it doesn't dissapoint for the most part. The games levels retain the same amount of detail with a bit of polish and the models are now more modern besting the original polyginal characters. All the loading screens have been updated as well coming as close to the originals as possible with updates such as animations and screen effects, the screens also retain the creepy musical loops from the original. A big improvement to the gameplay is the overall control feels far more natrual in this adaptation, with feeling of fighting with the controls as in the original. All of the key levels from the original here are present plus some new ones. 

However, the games ending level is changed from the original games. 
In the original:
[spoiler]Postal Dude has a mental breakdown before he shoots up an elementry school[/spoiler] 
In the Redux:
[spoiler]Postal Dude runs into a church courtyard as a priest is preforming a burial as strange audio effects are heard and he breaksdown[/spoiler]

This isn't a deal breaker in my opinion but I think it would be beneficial to view the original ending on YouTube as I feel it matches the games tone more. The ending screens and text though, are pretty much the same otherwise.

In short: Aside from a slightly altered ending Postal Redux is a great way to play as a mass shooter who believes he's saving the world from...something. It is also a far more funner to play and a bit more polished than the 1997 original.

But I never saw Postal 1 till I bought this game recently for 1 euro on steam and it's indeed crazy. It's like they took the rampage missions from GTA and made a whole new game with that concept.

It's a dark twin stick shooter. You are just a murdering maniac shooting down as many people as you can in public places.

It takes you back to the nineties, when brutal, bloody political incorrect games were something new and threating. Feeling like you were doing something that you shoudn't do. Making parents scared that you were being turned into a terrorist.

BTW,, remember Phobia II? Probably not.... That was also another sick twin stick shooter from WAH software. It was a cheap game based on Starship Troopers. I played that game with a friend. One played with the wasd keys another with the arrow keys on the keyboard. And somehow it brings that nostalgic feeling back... Totally different games but released the same year... The graphics are on the same level... Whatever, buy this game. It's part of gaming history, essential to play.

26324566.review:
Now, you might already know that Postal is not a "nice" game. Unlike Postal 2 it's not even a sarcastic dark humorous game. It's disturbing, yet stress-relieving. It shows age despite the fantastic update, but there was still nothing as surprisingly good. Something that doesn't turn into a cringe-fest or something that is outright unpleasant to play.

If you haven't played the original, this is a top-down action game about a Dude who went Postal and started a murder spree in a small town. There's no real story, no real reason. Just a lot of disturbing level intros, clearly unhinged main character, unnerving industrial noises for soundtrack and many weapons to kill all "hostiles" (armed opposition, mostly police) with an option to kill everyone else too. What's surprising is that, while what happens is not "nice", game never becomes disgusting to play. Oddly satisfying, in fact, if you're frustrated especially. Additional levels are more in tone with sarcastic Postal 2, but the original is all darkness, without being depressive. 

If you have played the original, this is a fantastic update that keeps the tone of the old game but subtly updates and improves it in every possibly way. With mouse and gamepad support, nice level intro animations, new 3D models and redrawned 2D backgrounds. There's bunch of new stuff too and no more "press F1 to end level" not obviousness -_-. As someone who could never finish the original due to outdated and clunky controls, I was happy to finally play the game to the end. The only thing that could be viewed by some as a "downgrade" is the fact that the final mission is "toned down". To be fair, though, the current version feels like it makes more tonal sense and fits the mood much better.

26323274.review:
Uno sguardo nel passato, ma se tutto va bene quello che vedrete non vi piacerà. Violenza senza giustificazione, ma non del tipo che ti aspetti dai soliti titoli americani dove è naturale sparare alla gente senza pensarci troppo. Nonostante la grafica e gli artwork semplici, si intravede la follia che i creatori del gioco hanno voluto fare traspirare. Questo gioco usa liberamente la violenza, e riesce ad ottenere una reazione di disgusto, di rendersi conto che si sta facendo qualcosa di sbagliato.

Più che altro a parlare sono gli spezzoni di testo nelle schermate di caricamento tra un livello e l'altro, insieme alle grida di aiuto della gente che viene massacrata. La colonna sonora e l'insieme di tutto l'artwork completano perfettamente l'atmosfera opprimente che stona con la realtà. Non c'è parodia, satira o strizzate d'occhio (che invece saranno colonna portante dei sequels).

Tecnicamente l'unica cosa necessaria all'originale (del 1997) era uno schema di controlli un po' più moderno, senza i comandi "a carro armato" con minimo supporto per il mouse. E in questo il remake funziona perfettamente. Altri dettagli tecnici però scadono, i livelli sono ri-disegnati (si, sono immagini disegnate) e sono fedeli all'originale, mentre tutto il resto è rappresentato da modelli 3d abbastanza basici (comunque sempre visti da una certa distanza, quindi se ci sono dettagli fini si perdono). Non ho ben capito perchè andare ad utilizzare l'Unreal Engine 4, a naso mi verrebbe da dire che sarebbe venuto fuori un prodotto qualitativamente uguale (probabilmente meglio performante) con un motore meno pretenzioso in termini di potenza computativa (GameMaker? Unity? Le meccaniche sono abbastanza basilari, non c'è bisogno di motori così potenti).

Ci metto un consigliato non tanto per le sue qualità di videogioco, ma perchè è un pezzo di storia da provare, uno dei pochi esempi di giochi fatti con in mente la violenza e il disagio mentale veri, e non solo un gioco dove si spara perchè è l'espressione di default per il giocatore. 

Non riesco a immaginarmi qualcuno che si preoccupa genuinamente per la violenza in un GTA qualsiasi dopo averci giocato di persona. Se però qualcuno mi dicesse che c'è un problema con la violenza sei videogiochi dopo aver passato qualche ora con il primo Postal (o questo suo remake), beh, mi verrebbe difficile dargli torto.

26257861.review:
For those of you who never played the original Postal, I'll let you know that it wasn't a wacky and silly game like Postal 2 is. This game tried its hardest to be as offensive as possible. It was an isometric shooter that had only one goal in mind: kill as many cops/swat/soldiers/ect as you could while innocent civilians run around in the crossfire, until the game allows you to move on to the next level. Postal 1 caused quite a stir during 1997 in both the media and in politics, but combined with mindlessly fun gameplay and dark attempts at humor, the game became the definition of a cult classic.

For those of you who have played the original Postal, this redux version polished a lot of the old things while adding in a bunch of new things. The graphics look far better, there's new levels to play on, there's a brand new "rampage" game mode that adds more playability, it supports 4 player coop, and there's a new revolver to shoot people with. But probably the best thing about this Postal Redux is that the dreadful controls from the original have been fixed. Gone are the tanky and sluggish feeling the old game had for controls, they've been replaced with full mouse support. Things like moving around, aiming, and shooting feels natural and is a breeze to do now.

My only real complaint is that it feels like there's much less dark humor in this redux than there was in the original. However, if you're a fan of the postal series, or just like playing games with wanton and senseless amounts of violence, Postal Redux is well worth the $8.99 to buy it. 4.0/5.0

25990075.review:
[h1]Дай человеку огонь, и ему будет тепло до конца дня. Подожги человека, и ему будет тепло до конца его жизни.(с)[/h1]
Не, цитата, пришпиленная к отзыву на видеоигру, умнее меня не делает(как и обитателей тематических пабликов), она почти описывает хаос, происходящий на экране.
Когда мы говорим о Постале, мы говорим не о произошедших благодаря игре новым веяниям в жанре или какой-то революции.
Мы скорее говорим о том, чего не произошло благодаря тому, что в своё время некоторые люди могли выпускать пар в ней.
Она порвала жопки кое-каким правозащитникам(впрочем, ничего нового) и тогда это в принципе было довольно смело, делать такие игры.
С того момента прошла просто туева хуча времени и конечно она никому не даст тех самых ощущений, потому что геймплей уже достаточно устарел, насилие уже не выглядит так круто, только визуальное и звуковое оформление напоминает о нездоровости событий в игре, придавая чернушности происходящему.
(Redux вообще всё херит в этом плане уродливым 3D.)
Postal был просто top-down шутером с огромным количеством оружия, который отличался от своих собратьев только одной маленькой деталью - вместо демонов, пришельцев и прочей ереси, которую в играх можно и принято валить(они ж не люди), главным врагом гг выступало всё человечество(в оригинале ещё и управление, чтобы жизнь мёдом не казалась а игровой процесс сказкой), причём у главного героя были ярко выраженные проблемы с головой, что придавало особого колорита происходящему и подавалось через загрузочные экраны и его дневник, который немного отличался по содержанию в зависимости от сложности.
Вы не были сказочным рыцарем, солдатом армии США и супермэном(что практически одно и то же), вы играли роль поехавшего почтальона. Вот и всё, вот и весь секрет успеха.
Насилие ради насилия.
С другой стороны вы можете побегать в коопе с друзьями, что оставляет в тебе ощущение того, что тут что-то не так и в целом неправильно.
Зы: RWS вроде заняты новым тайтлом.

25812121.review:
This was my final purchase in the series as of this point. Bought it to complete the, ahem, official series, was half-worried it wouldn't be enough of an improvement from the original to warrant the purchase. Not sure why, probably propaganda.

The graphics retain the clear, block of color style of the original while adding something special, blah blah blah, you can see that for yourself in screenshots, I'll get to the gameplay.

Having played both ways, (my controller decided it didn't want to convey input properly partway through) I can say that, unlike the original, this enjoyable with both keyboard and controller. That said, unless controls are a LOT better, there really seems to have been a difficulty tweak from the original. However, any difficulty tweak that doesn't involve getting kicked in the face by a guy wearing night vision goggles is alright with me.

Mechanic-wise, it's very similar to the original, you view the action from above, though as previously mentioned, you've got better control of it. I'm, uh, I'm not sure how to duck, though. Should probably figure that out, seeing as there's an achievement for avoiding rockets 10 times by ducking. One of my few gripes is the lack of sound position, I keep thinking someone off to the side is yelling, before realizing, upon their, let's say incapacitation, it was in fact the person I was actively engaging.

I'd like to see a couple more singleplayer modes, since I don't have any friends who own this game, but perhaps this is a better game to play with randoms, who knows?

The story, while partially covered throughout the game, isn't a big part of it. You don't need to know in-depth why things are happening, just that they are. Rampage mode even has a bit of story associated with it, framing the action almost as a competition.


+ Great and well-deserved remake of the original
+ Almost pure gameplay
+ Controls greatly improved
+ Rick Hunter

- Sound seems to come from one spot
- Only two singleplayer modes

First thing to know is that POSTAL Redux is NOT a funny game like POSTAL 2.
The original POSTAL and Redux are both pretty dark and grim in comparison to POSTAL 2.

I'm a [i]really[/i] big POSTAL fan, but I'll make this one short:

This is the [b]DEFINITIVE[/b] version of POSTAL.

- [i]SAY GOODBYE[/i] to those old clunky controls and welcome in the new crosshairs [b]which show you enemy health levels indicated from green to red(dead).[/b]
- [i]IMPROVED 3D MODELS[/i] that aren't too demanding of even my very low-end laptop.
- [b][i]TOTALLY RE-DONE[/i] Level art![/b]
- [b]BRAND NEW  Rampage Mode![/b] (Earn a grade from F through A+ on each of the levels)
- [b]CO-OP MULTIPLAYER![/b]
- [b]BRAND NEW weapon[/b] - [i][b]the revolver![/b][/i]
- [b]6 FREE maps[/b] just added on Sept. 30 2016 from Super Postal[b](Tokyo and Osaka)[/b] and POSTAL Plus[b](EZ Mart, Shanty Town, Earthquake, and La Palamino Resort)[/b]
-[b]1 ENTIRELY NEW MAP created just for this game[/b]
- [b]2 SECRET PLAYABLE CHARACTERS[/b] for online and solo play!
- [b]NEW ACHIEVEMENTS[/b] - Unlock 'em with your friends, OR make some [i]new[/i] friends to go [i]'POSTAL'[/i] with!

[b]** The classic M16-styled assault rifle from the original game has been replaced with an MP5-styled SMG that has a smaller range, but improved firing speed.[/b]

Anything wrong with how the first game played in terms of controls, etc. has totally been re-vamped. With the huge imrpovements AND the free added content and free DLC, [b][i]EASILY[/i] a must-buy.[/b] Even at full price, in my humble opinion.

[i][b]10/10[/b][/i]

25791685.review:
Ive gotten as far as the Carnival on this game, 112 minutes as of writing this review. 

I have to say its better than the original, FAR better. ive never gotten this far on medium on the original before.

the originals controls felt clunky, tank controls are what they were called. The gamepad support is spot on, the original didnt have this. The postal dude seems to be faster this time around, the switching between weapons and throwables are quicker and easier than ever. 

The art, new enemy models, and additions to this make this version far superior.

this game THRIVES on being a Twin Stick shooter. 

the only downside i can see is that starting the game takes forever, the original booted quickly, postal 2 took a while to start up but wasnt this bad. Even DOOM (2016) doesnt take this long to boot up to the main menu. it took a few before POSTAL appeared in a box on the screen, showing up on the task bar on my computer. and even after that it felt like a whole minute i had waited once it went full screen and the Running With Scissors logo stopped spinning and it dropped me to the main menu. Additionally the innitial loading screen when starting a new game seemed a bit long too, but not as long as boot was for me. I just dont feel like on a HDD running at 7500 RPM on a high end gaming computer should take 10 seconds to load the first level of a game like this.     ---- but honestly this was all minor, because after the first level, the second level only took about 5 seconds to load, and every other level took the same amount of time as the previous one took to load. 

Additionally there are a few jabs and knocks on HATRED, a similar game inspired by the original this redux was based on. there are color modes in the game and one filters the colors to be nearly like HATRED has in the games art style. and if you hit "T" in game, and type "MyNameIsNotImportant" and hit enter, you will unlock "NotImportant" a fully voiced and modeled character of the HATRED dude. im suprised they included this. you need to go to GAME in the menu (when you pause) and press A or click on the option for color (not the left and right variables!) to change your character. 

Honestly i like this more than HATRED, i havent finished HATRED due to its bugs, the game does look better than POSTAL Redux... but it plays the same and has litterally ZERO BUGS. 

POSTAL Redux includes several other filters for coloring, CO-OP (havent tried yet), the POSTAL PLUS Levels, multiple colors to use for the postal dude, a clown to play as, extra levels, civilians that flee from buildings that add more to your body count. and the rocket launcher guy i swear looks exactly like Sargent Killgore from Apocalypse Now.... 

Bottom line, THIS IS GOOD
THIS IS AN IMPROVEMENT

RWS MAKE POSTAL 4 ALREADY!!!! TAKE MY MONEY


EDIT 3 hours into the game, finished with the special levels finished, i have to say even at full price which i believe is around $ 8.99 USD. This game IS worth it. ignore the metacritic reviews, those nearly all of those outlets ive never heard of, not even polygon, IGN, Gamespot or Kotaku has reviewed this yet, so no one of note has written a published review. this game has ALOT of content, and is really worth its full price.

東京ステージは90年台後期の秋葉原中央通り交差点以南から万世橋警察署あたりまでをモチーフにしている　現代の秋葉原と比べてみよう

しかし我々が彼の残虐性に嫌悪を感じれば感じるほど、彼は自らを英雄視していった。

その様な人間が、「全世界の人間は自分と共にある」と信ずるに至ったとしても、何ら不可解なことではない。
我々の最終的な課題は、あらゆる偏執的妄想の兆候を示すことである。
何が彼をこの様な行動に駆り立てたのか。
我々が理解できることは決してない。
その一方で、彼を研究する時間が十分あることも確かなのである。 [/spoiler]

25604405.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: This review is being cast as a full review and not a first impressions review because the main bulk of the game is finished, although POSTAL Redux does have a story mode, it also has different modes with the same levels, hence, this review is being cast as full because the main bulk of the game is complete, so please, think before you comment! Enjoy :) [/quote]

POSTAL Redux is a revamped version of the original controversial game of the same name; POSTAL, developed and published by Running With Scissors (RWS for short). The original game, when it was released, was a controversial game due to its amount of violence towards the police and towards the innocent. Thankfully, RWS hasn't given up on their POSTAL series (except POSTAL 3, we will pretend that never happened) and has continued to develop and improve their games

POSTAL Redux has an improved engine, if I am not mistaken this game was developed with the Unreal 4 Engine, better graphics, better sound and better music. Everything better. It also includes a Co-Op option which the original game did not have

So what is the best way to describe POSTAL and POSTAL Redux?

If you heard of the not so recent game, also controversial, called Hatred. Which was a game about a person going rampage and shooting police and many innocent people. POSTAL and POSTAL Redux are like Hatred, only better and more enjoyable

You play a simple guy called The Postal Dude and the main objective of the game is to shoot as many hostiles as possible (after 90%, you are free to go to the next level) which includes shooting police and many, many innocent people and also causing havok which is what made POSTAL Redux fun and enjoyable

Now, I am not the type of person who is easily offended. I've played both POSTAL Redux and Hatred and wasn't offended, I watch the South Park series and played the South Park games and whenever I see things that other people get offended by, I don't. So I understand why the POSTAL series caused so much controversy but at the same time, I don't care

The game is much more dark than its sequel, and this was a shock to me as I watched so many videos of POSTAL 2 (and now I own the game) where you hit people and urinate on them whereas in POSTAL and POSTAL Redux, it seems like Satan has taken over your soul and you just want to murder people. A huge shift in tone between the two games

The gameplay is that of any type of shooter. Shoot as many people as possible without dying. The camera is that of an isometric perspective, meaning that the camera is of a top down perspective. The graphics (which POSTAL suffered quite a lot and were quite ugly) have greatly improved in the Redux version. The music is sick and twisted which I surprisingly liked and the voice acting by both the Postal dude and the innocent victims is good

To play POSTAL and POSTAL Redux, you will need an open mind or someone like me who isn't easily offended and the game is certainly not playable for people who are easily offended. I would only recommend POSTAL and POSTAL Redux to people who don't mind the subject matter or people who are not easily offended, otherwise, steer clear away from POSTAL, POSTAL Redux or POSTAL 2

If you are interested in POSTAL, I would highly recommend purchasing the Redux version of it!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

25559807.review:
''A pressão populacional e o stress da vida moderna podem causar e aumentar tendências violentas, o cenário urbano é uma incubadora de comportamentos indesejáveis'' 

Memóravel, Postal 1 traz o ''Postal Guy'' que certo dia resolve sair atirando nas pessoas, o nome do jogo vem de um termo chamado ''Going Postal'' que é quando uma pessoa basicamente ''endoida'' e sai espalhando sua fúria por aí, no caso desse jogo, muito bem armado e perigoso.
Para a época (1997) o jogo era muito pesado (até porque era incomum esse tipo de temática, e o GTA ainda engatinhava), criar um jogo onde seu objetivo é simplesmente assassinar pessoas era algo que deixou muita gente horrorizada, até porque menos de 2 anos depois ocorreria o ''Massacre de Columbine'' lá nos EUA e o caso do ''Atirador do Shopping Center'' aqui no Brasil, Postal é um jogo que eu considero mais pelo impacto da época do que pelo jogo em si, até porque ele sempre é uma espécie de ''fotografia'' para nos lembrar das maldades que ocorreram no final da década de 90 e até onde o ser humano é capaz de ir.

Pros:

- Os gráficos em HD ficaram legais, dão um ar de ''desenhado a mão''
- O menu é perturbador, as imagens durante os loadings são perturbadoras, é incrível como essa versão nos mostra a maldade através de imagens simples desenhadas a mão
- Os sons continuam os mesmos, gritos, tiros, pedidos de socorro, os sons do menu são bem malignos, dando uma ótima ''boas vindas'' ao jogador
- A curva de aprendizagem é muito fácil, é basicamente andar e atirar e tomar cuidado com os tiros, pegar armas e munição no cenário, matou todo mundo, passa pro próximo, até zerar
- Grande variedade de armas, desde pistolas até bazucas e lança chamas
- Modo cooperativo (apesar de eu achar que ''quebra'' o sentido do jogo)
- Modo extra (um pouco difícil) de rampage

Contras:

- O jogo é de 1997, a versão redux não trouxe física, nem destruição, nada, ele ainda permanece exatamente como era, então quem procura algum tipo de ''remake'' pode esquecer
- O jogo ''devora'' memória ram, inexplicavelmente, pois é um jogo de 1997
- O jogo é curtíssimo (inclusive tem uma proeza se zerar ele em meia hora!), então vai depender do nível que voce joga e da sua habilidade
- O boneco é um pouco estranho pra se mover, ele não é muito ágil, a jogabilidade ainda é a mesma de 1997, poderiam ter melhorado um pouco nesse aspecto
- Removeram a fase ''Elementary School'', o que me decepcionou MUITO, pois era marca registrada do jogo e praticamente uma profecia de acontecimentos da época

No geral Postal é um jogo que marcou por ter ousado usar a violencia pura e simples como marketing, foi perseguido e demonizado tanto quanto Carmageddon, GTA, ManHunt e outros jogos da época ou posteriores, mas que é um item que esfrega na cara da sociedade os monstros que ela mesma cria e alimenta, as vezes de maneira proposital.
Todos temos um ''Postal Guy'' dentro de nós, basta um dia ruim...

25422424.review:
The plot of Postal is deliberately kept vague as to not distract from the gameplay. From what can be gathered through the original website, manual, and the game itself, an average man known only as the Postal Dude discovers that a mind altering substance has been released on the town of Paradise, infecting the populace with insanity and blood-lust. Capped off by his sudden eviction from his home, the Postal Dude believes himself to be the only sane man left and sets out to put an end to the madness in his town, which he believes originates from the local Air-Force Base. (Copy and Pasted off The Postal wikia: http://postal.wikia.com/wiki/POSTAL) 
Now to the gameplay of POSTAL. This game is one of my favorites maybe my favorite game i've played, the gameplay is fun and action packed and scary and the game never gets dull to me no matter how many times I have played it through (3 times on The Original POSTAL and 3 times again on POSTAL: Redux). One thing great the redux does is fix the controls, as when I play the original it took a bit to get used to the controls but for the redux I caught on immediatly. Another reason why you should buy redux is the fact that it is a faithful recreation of the original (they did add one new map though being The Carnival and they added a new weapon, witch both I absolutely love) and don't forget CO-OP, one of the biggest reasons to buy the redux is for the co-op. 
POSTAL: Redux CO-OP: I aboslutely love that they added CO-OP with this game, it is really fun to go play this game with friends, as me and my friend had a blast going around paradise blasting our way through "The evil" ;P (One thing is that if you plan on getting for co-op get a copy to a friend as their is no servers open most of the time sadly :c)
TL;DR: BUY THE GAME ALREADY, oh yeah and don't play on easy, play on hard; the more difficult this game is the more fun it is.

25406627.review:
As someone who didn't enjoy any Postal game I gotta admit the Redux is quite an improvement over the 1997 version.

First of all, the control schemes are now much more fluid and intuitive. Instead of rotating "A" and "D" moves the character to the left and to the right of the screen. This modification might sounds like a tiny one but it greatly improves on the gameplay as it is easier (and more fair) to dodge missiles coming at you and running for cover. Of course, the enhanced visuals are greatly appreciated not to the mention the additional survival mode.

Despite all of these improvements the game is not without flaw since the level of violence feels the same as the original. I may sound like a desensitized person but I was hoping for a more gory game, like some dismemberments and gibs. Also, the arsenal is a bit lackluster. The rocket launcher, napalm launcher and flamethrower are more or less useful since they are high risk high reward. This is why I ended up using the submachinegun, the shotgun and the magnum most of the time.

Overall Postal Redux is definitively worth a buy although being only a decent game.

Rating:
7.0 / 10

25346651.review:
THEY FIXED THE CONTROLS! 

Instead of aiming and shooting with the arrow keys you can now just use the mouse to aim, so the game no longer feels like you're playing Dance Dance Revolution with your right hand, and the game is worth the money for that alone. 

Also, you can now shoot in any direction instead of just 8. This means you can actually hit moving targets instead of having to wait for them to stand still until you can get a decent shot. 

You can also run while shooting, so that when you're busy murdering a police officer and some dipshit decides to shoot a rocket your way, you can actually dodge it without giving your victim time to get up, load his shotgun and pump 5 shells into your back.

The only negative point that I have is that the loading times are fucking atrocious.

After every level you have enough time to get up, go to the kitchen to make a cup of coffee, realise you don't have any milk, curse a god you've never believed in, go to the totally all-American grocery store to get some, decide you don't want to pay $5 for a carton of milk, go through the back door, fight off a group of angry terrorist women, jump out of the window, smoke some crack to get your health back and go back home just in time for the next level to be done loading.


But overall, it's a huge improvement on Postal, and totally worth it. 

EDIT: Loading times have been fixed


9/10

25125833.review:
The year 2017 will mark the second decade since the landmark, cult-classic game POSTAL was released into the world. Controversy sparked from every corner of the dark title, especially due to its gruesome ending and remorseless killing. It took Running With Scissors a few years, but they finally latched on to the success of the series and eventually birthed POSTAL 2 and 3 into the world; those are reviews for another time, however. 

POSTAL Redux is not just a simple graphical overhaul of the original title, instead it's a complete revamp of the game done in Unreal Engine 4. The makeover definitely shows, not only in the aesthetic presentation of the game, but also the fluid, up-to-date controls that make the Redux so much easier to play over its predecessor. There are many notable differences between POSTAL Redux and the first POSTAL, which will be taken a look at within this review.

For those who have played the first POSTAL, feel free to skip this paragraph. Those of you questioning what the game is all about, stick around. In POSTAL, you play as an antagonist who's simply known as The Postal Dude; some say he's schizophrenic, some say he's a madman, some like to believe he's a pretty nice guy. Either way, The Postal Dude has a theory that his hometown of Paradise, Arizona is being flooded with mind-altering substances; he starts believing that he is the only individual who is unaffected. Once he gets evicted from his home, he starts a murderous rampage of blood-lust, and doesn't stop until he reaches the Military Air Base; where he believes the source of the noxious gas is stemming from.

For long-time fans of the series, you may be upset to know that Running With Scissors have changed the iconic ending in the Redux. There's no longer [spoiler]an elementary school with children running around at the end of the game, but the laughter of the children can still be heard as you wander along a cemetery[/spoiler]. The interpretation of this is up to the individual, but the same end cutscene is still present after the last "level" plays out. In my experience, the new Redux ending is much less impacting than the original, and the game loses some of its overall morbidity due to it.

The original POSTAL had 21 levels, plus four extra levels from the Special Delivery expansion pack, the Redux only has 17 levels in total with one of them being the newly created Carnival map; so it's safe to say that Running With Scissors trimmed the fat a little bit. As well, the difficulty of this title is nowhere near that of the original, and seasoned players will find even the hard difficulty severely lacking in comparison to POSTAL's "11" difficulty setting. However, this could be something that is fixed in the future, as the Redux has been receiving regular updates since its release in May, 2016.

The developer claims that the visuals are a "faithful" recreation of the original, and quite honestly I haven't seen a difference in them other than the fact that they're of higher resolution and thus much more clear. This is a good thing, as it genuinely looks as though the original hand-painted backgrounds have been re-scanned in a superior format; if someone redid all of the backgrounds, kudos to them as they look like the real deal. As for the character models, they're noticably upgraded from the Playstation 1-era models from the original game, and you can even change The Postal Dude's trench coat color.

It's safe to say that the Redux functions like any other modern top-down shooter now. In the original, it was difficult to control The Postal Dude with both the keyboard and mouse, due to the games age and engine limitations. The Redux sees to it that the mouse control is extremely fluid, as is the aiming/targeting system and ability to switch between weapons with the scroll wheel. Not to mention, the Redux can also be played with a console controller, for those who are not fond of keyboard and mouse controls.

Other than the upgraded visuals and lack of levels, POSTAL Redux has some other notable changes. One of the biggest additions is the new executions. In the original game, no matter what gun you were using The Postal Dude would switch back to his AR-16 for the execution of downed enemies, now each gun has its own unique animation. Another fantastic feature is when playing on Hard mode, the journal entries that show up between levels read as they appeared in the original manual of POSTAL; on Easy and Medium they simply stay the same as what is shown in the first game. There's a new revolver weapon, the machine gun (or SMG in this version) has a higher rate of fire and range, the shotgun and spray cannons do not share the same ammo any longer, the journal entry dates all read 2017 as opposed to 1997, and the newly introduced Rampage mode is a bit like the Gauntlet Challenge from the original game.

Sadly, POSTAL Redux does have a major downfall; the game likes to crash... a lot. The amount of crashing that still occurs despite the numerous updates to the title is unacceptable. Running With Scissors just released an update that implemented 4 player co-op, yet they cannot find the time to rectify crashes that skew the players experience with the game? That's just hard for me to believe. The game will crash during level transitions, during start up, but most of all during the Rampage mode.

With that being said, if you can live with the amount of crashing that this game likes to do, then POSTAL Redux will be a great addition to your collection of violent, twisted, dark humored games. The complete engine overhaul has really brought the classic POSTAL title up to speed in the modern world, although it would be nice if Running With Scissors left all of the levels intact instead of picking which ones to keep in and leave out; it would've also been nice to have the original ending. The audio is also completely remastered, so The Postal Dude's witty and sarcastic comments  can be heard crystal clear now. As well, I'm sure the newly introduced 4 player online co-op will appeal to a large range of gamers. If you've never played POSTAL before, this is an excellent starting point. If you're a long-time fan of the series, you won't be disappointed.

Side note, thanks RWS for releasing on my B-day

This game is fun. Shoot-em-up arcade horror game where you are the "monster". This time, we have a few new endings, too. I have to say Rampage mode is extremely fun. The game later explains how you've been put into his psyche as loading screens turn from hints into insane garbles about perfection and wooing an unknown crowd. It also makes everything a little more fast paced, with some very fun metal music and a combo that mutliplies the player's score. I had a lot of trouble beating it with my noob skills, so I usually ended up with Fs (guess I was wooing Mr. Crocker).

Returning for the psychological horror is the main campaign itself, which is almost a 100% remake of the old game, but better looking, better playing, and better controlled. The Journal entries and art are just as creepy as ever, and even animated, too. There's a new carnival level, too, but I've only been there in Rampage. There are very adorable clowns shooting at the Dude, using colorful SMGs. 

Controls are a hell of a lot better than the original steam version (no more right click to move forward, right click now grenades, though), it now plays a lot similar to other isometric games, like hatred. The art is a lot better looking, and it fits in a lot with the new character models. Ending the disc version Red Coat vs PP Blue Coat vs Black Coat Steam version is an option to change the coat color. There's a part on the forums where a dev shown the colors off [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/401680/discussions/0/351660338718522844/]here[/url] if you want to see them. [h1]TL;DR at Bottom[/h1]
[b]If you enjoyed this review,consider giving it a thumbs up![/b]

[h1]Being a psychopath has never been this fun[/h1]
[b]Recommended Purchase[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=734792995
Postal Redux is an isometric shooter with a very dark and unnerving spin since instead of killing demented demons or aliens, your job is to slaughter civillians and those who would come to their aid. Postal is a very unique game since in many other games you might play as the noble knight who vanquishes demons or maybe an elite special ops soldier who stops terrorists but Postal poses a very unique question, what happens when the demon is you? Postal is essentially a game that takes the traditional good guys beat bad guys mindset and turns it on its head and puts you in the role of making sure that the bad guys win. This is a very unique game since even in the other Postal games they're more comical and here in the original instead of laughing while peeing on people you're setting towns aflame and fighting with the demons in your mind.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=734792963
Postals game mechanics are very simple and very sweet, if a bit repetitive at times. Postal gives you a variety of weapons you can use ranging from basics like a revolver or a shotgun to a flamethrower and a rocket launcher. The problem is that you're given so many weapons but you only end up using one or two of them since you can use those same weapons for just about every situation in the game. I wish there was more variation with the enemies as well since they're all the exact same thing with the only difference being their models, weapons, and the amount of bullets they soak up. The levels however, are varied and interesting as you fight at carnivals, in a military base, or even in a mine at one point. The levels are generally very straightforward with the exception of a couple secret areas off to the sides where you can grab some extra armor or ammunition. When you make a game with the main mechanic being shooting people you have to make sure that the guns feel very responsive, unique, and fun to use and that's something Postal definitely doesn't do. The first gun you get is an MP5 submachine gun and it feels incredibly responsive but also extremely weak at the same time and this is how just about all the games weapons feel which is a shame since shooting people is ninety nine percent of what you're doing in Postal.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=734792980
Postal is a game that set the standard for what was considered to be crossing the line and although some may find the game disturbing there is something to be said about a company like RWS who was willing to cross that line and push the boundaries or what is considered okay. While the media called the game deplorable and claimed it glorified violence Postal is actually quite an interesting look into a fascinating story of a man gone mad by the stresses of modern life and really makes you think as to whether you're a murdering psychopath who butchers people and laughs or maybea broken man who was locked up for reasons he couldn't understand.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Postal Redux is a psychotic look into what happens when instead of butchering demons, the demon is you.

24615022.review:
[h1] Postal, The legend, the classic[/h1]

What's the defining factor for a medium of entertainment to be worthy to be called a "classic"? It varies, it greatly varies. The most common ones, the ones that everyone can agree with are those which receive a "universally acclaimed" status, the innovative, genre-defining games, or the highly stylistic ones, though it usually lack on substance. And then there are the arguable "so bad it's good", "niche", "bold", "guilty pleasure" one. And that, everyone, is what embodies the original 1997 Postal.  A game that echoes controversy since it's release, panned by critics, yet loved by many. It's bold, it's a niche, sub par quality all across the board, it's certainly a guilty plleasure. It's the ultimate slasher B-movie of video games. Edgy, disturbing, tasteless, and pretty much senseless. But why? Why a game with such "quality" receieved a classic status? It's simply because Postal is self aware, it capitalize it's strength perfectly, it has one solid and clear purpose, that is GOING FUCKING POSTAL. 

Simplicity and straightforward-ness is the key, Postal is a "twin stick isometric mass murdering and maniacally laugh your ass off while you do so" game, and that's it. Compared to the more well known, evenly infamous, satire-laden successor, Postal 2. Postal 1 has a darker, more serious tone.  Adapting an arcade style level where you have to kill a certain percentage of total hostile in order to continue (would be a good way to teach kids some math). It's a game that knows it's audience (read: Edgy teens that constanly has a bad day but well aware that burning down their entire neighborhood is illegal). And that's why it holds a special place on the rank of classic video games.

Twenty years and "Mass murdering and laugh your ass off while doing so" games are getting more accepted, more open, mainstream, and "inventive". Games like Postal is considered comical violence this time around, so when the news arise that this little diamond is getting a remake, I can't help but wondering, is it really the right move? Yes, it is! 

[h1] Adding the much needed substance[/h1]

Postal Redux, to put it simply is basically the entirety of Postal has a major conversion to Unreal Engine 4. It's 1997 Postal as you know it, with much improved graphic and effects, reworked sound design, and having a modern control scheme. Aside minor gameplay tweaks, a new weapon, and the Rampage Mode, Postal, at it's core remain unchanged. Gameplay is more faster paced and more fluid, since the transition from 2D sprites to 3D model and much better aiming are the most welcomed changes. There is also a Rampage mode that turns Postal to a fully arcade game, with high score and kill multiplier that adds some replay value and challenge. I'm glad that RWS know exactly what they are doing, working on what really matters on modern video games, it's the pace and fluidity. 

Though, with these overhaul a little bit of things has to be "sacrificed", with the much cleaner, more professionally handled sound design and softer, more HD looks of the game, the creepy and disturbing tone of the original Postal is noticeably toned down, the overall roughness and budget-tier production of the original is the defining characteristic, which is unfortunate. 

[h1] (Almost) perfect remake, definitely not perfect time[/h1]

While I think Postal Redux is one of the most successful remake for me, the game itself didn't age well. As I said earlier, people are no stranger to violent video games as of now, in fact they are getting more open, complex, and inventive. Simplicity is both the strength and weakness of Postal Redux, I won't go to the strengths because I've allready cover that, let's focus on the weakness. Simplicity brings repetitiveness, most of the time. There is simply not enough replay value on Postal Redux, finished the campaign 2 times, get all achievements, and the rest on Rampage mode everytime you have a bad day. "Is it the whole point of Postal?", you ask. Well yes, it is, but with "only" that, I think the price is bit too high. Yes, I know RWS will keep it updated just like they did with Postal 2 (which is awesome), but I still think it's kinda lacking. Opening the gate for mods, at the very least a level editor will be a welcome addition, and MP seems cool. 

[h1] It lives, and it's glorious![/h1]

In conclusion, Postal Redux is a remake, done right. RWS knows what makes Postal good, and don't tinker with it, instead they worked with something that really matters in order to "modernize" a game. Postal Redux is a glorious reminder of the infamouse 1997 classic, brought back to life with all of it's mindless fun-madness. It's a throwback of the simplicity of 90's games, a proof that you just need a clear purpose and capitalize on it to make a fun game, though it did bring lack of replay value, with the absent of mods, for today's standard.

24339992.review:
POSTAL Redux. Достаточно непростой обзор для меня. Я обожаю первый постал, поэтому мне трудно быть полностью объективным относительно редукса.
  Начнём с того, он мне понравился. Во время его прохождения я получал удовольствие, так что назвать его плохим у меня язык не повернётся. Но вот парадокс: плюсов в игре я практически не нашёл. Отмечу только то, что заставки теперь в HD качестве, что не может не радовать.
  А теперь к минусам. Игра определённо хуже оригинала. Атмосфера безумия, психоза и прочих прелестей отсутствует напрочь. Первая часть была довольно атмосферным психологическим триллером. Тут такого нет. Весёлый боевичек, не более. Да, атмосферу пытались передать, но получилось, как вы уже поняли, не особо. Почему? Тут мы плавно перейдём к следующему пункту.
  Графон. Он абсолютно не сочетается с фонами. Нет, выглядит картинка достаточно приятно, но не подходят игре эти модельки. Именно из-за него, как мне кажется, атмосфера и портится.
  Сложность. Её тут нет. Игра проходится на изи. Умереть мне удавалсь только когда я бежал ну совсем уж сломя голову. Никакой стратегичности оригинала тут не присутствует. Главный герой - неубиваемый терминатор. Но, стоит отметить, что играется повеселее, чем оригинал.
  Что нового? - спросите вы. Это же, как - никак переиздание, должен же появиться новый контент. И он тут есть! Новая миссия и новое оружие - револьвер. Лучше бы уж не позорились и вообще ничего не добавляли.
  Итак, давайте подведём итог. По сути ничего особо хорошего в игре нет. Но, как я уже писал в начале этого обзора, играется достаточно весело. Только из-за этого я жму на кнопку "рекомендую". В остальном - проходняк.

24027265.review:
Since the vanilla game is still available for purchase, I'm going to focus only on the differences between that and the Redux version.

+++ All the levels have been reworked and now have HD graphics. This means better looking, higher resolution maps with added effects such as sirens for the police cars, falling leaves for trees and animated water on the bridge level. 
+++ The most noticeable of all are the 3D characters - no more pixelated Dude and NPCs; everybody looks very detailed.
+++ Fast-paced combat: The game is now much faster, thus more enjoyable.
+++ Better aiming system: It helps to see the crosshair appearing on enemies that can be shot from a certain distance already. Bullet spread is also visible. Overall better weapon handling - if you're a sharpshooter you're going to love the new revolver which is a great addition to the already existing weapon selection.
+++ Beside the campaign we now have a Rampage gameplay mode which makes the game a little more arcade-ish with the added score system. Multipliers keep increasing with each kill but only for a short period of time. This is a great mode for hardcore fans and for those looking for an extra challenge.

--- Several missing levels. I understand the absence of the high school (with the ongoing school shootings this is perfectly understandable), but other levels such as the holiday resort or the city devastated by earthquake are also missing. A new carnival level has been added with machine gun wielding clowns but it does not make up for the missing ones.

UPDATE (October, 2016). The game now has coop and the missing levels such as earthquake and mall are back. There's also shanty town and two Japanese maps. They are hilarious and heaps of fun to play. 

This is how you do a remastered edition! This is a great version and is a must for Postal fans.

24025428.review:
Everyone reaches a point in their lives when you just want to throw your hat into the air... punch the wall...  kick a few doors open, pull out a rocket launcher and blow stuff up... Ok.. well normal people never really have these things, sure we get angry but normally it passes.  Postal is what happens when a man gets pushed to the edge.  Tired of living by the rules society deems right, he throws caution to the wind and goes full on rampage mode ala Rambo  in the original first blood movie.  The major difference is Rambo had loads of Snarling, and Stallone...  Postal has... The Postal Dude and Loads of killing..  the whole point of Postal is to kill everyone, whether they be police officers, swat team, the army, innocent people enjoying a parade.. It doesn't matter.  Postal was pretty much a gigantic middle finger salute from the gaming industry trying to censor what we all love.

Nearly 20 years has passed since the original Postal released back in 1997.... Back in 1997 times were simple a blue dress was just a blue dress, and Cigars were made for smoking not... well anyway.. As time moved forward the original mass murdering simulator remained untouched, a relic of gaming past, adored by those who played it, feared by those who think technology is evil.  Relatively unknown to those who think a game needs cutting edge graphics to be good..  Fast Forward to 20016 and Postal has finally gotten the treatment it deserves, brought in line with modern technology, updated, improved and a reminder that no matter how screwed up life has gotten, kicking back, killing untold number of pixel shaped people can be a fun and exciting prospect.   Improved graphics, sounds and controller support.

[h1] Story [/h1]

The story remains the same, the Postal dude has had enough, he's been pushed, kicked, and abused for long enough, he's ready to take action, kick butts and chew some bubble gum (I think he's chewing bubble gum.. maybe that's Duke Nukem)  Starting from his home, you emerge and begin your visceral rampage on the people he thinks have wronged him....

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

The game is an isometric third person shooter.  The game features numerous weapons "The Dude" can use in his mission to end his oppression.  Assault Rifles, shotguns, pistols, rocket launchers, etc etc etc.  The goal of each level is having the Dude, kill a certain % of the population before heading to the exit.  The game features 17 levels, including a new Carnival stage. Enough Murder, madness and mayhem to make Charlie Manson smile...  Also newly included to the Redux version of the game is Rampage mode, which allows the gamer to go after the high score.. 

[h1] Pro's [/h1]
It's Postal,
The graphics are much nicer than the original
The game sounds alot better
Controller support (although K&M are better)
The Dude 

[h1] Con's [/h1]
The price tag is slightly high, even with the new additions and overhauls
Some stages present in the original have been removed (although they were DLC levels and hopefully will be added at a later date)
Controller support is nice, but leaves alot to be desired and makes aiming more of chore than it should be

[h1] Recommendation [/h1]

Postal and running with scissors will hold a place in my heart for ever..  I absolutely love everything Postal, even that movie by Uwe Boll (can be get it on steam guys.. please)  I am keeping my fingers crossed for Postal 4... (I'll forgive you for Postal 3..  I mean it did have Ron Jeremy in it)  While Postal feels better with the updated graphics, sounds and controls, I'm left to question if the full price upgrade is worth it.  Part of me say wait for a sale, while the Postal fanboy in me was like.. buy this now.. don't stop, don't cut off Monopoly man's head and use it as a soccer ball, don't wait any longer.  I love this game, one of those games that will be looked back on fifty years from now with warm feelings of admiration and awe.  So should you buy this.. Yes, you should, buy this game or Postal Dude will shove his gun up a Kittens butt and use him as a silencer..

Ho accolto con un certo scetticismo l'annuncio di questo gioco, credendo fosse una squallida operazione nostalgia, come purtroppo molto spesso oggi accade (alludo ad esempio all'inutile Chaos Engine uscito tre anni fa). E invece mi sono dovuto ricredere dopo appena dieci secondi netti di gioco: veloce, divertentissimo, classico gameplay che non inventa nulla ma convince terribilmente. Ci vuole solo un attimo per essere catapultati nuovamente nella strage. 

Questo gioco inoltre possiede uno spirito che richiama i migliori titoli dell'Amiga degli anni Novanta, cosa oggi più unica che rara. Tanto basta per consigliarne l'acquisto a chiunque sia alla ricerca di un twin shooter solido.

24005275.review:
Lo compré a un 50% de descuento. Si te gusta la saga postal y disfrutaste del primero, este juego te va a encantar. El primero juego, debo admitirlo, lo conseguí pirata hace un par de años. Lo jugaba sin parar, era genial. Ahora, que ya tengo dinero, lo compré (y a parte estaba barato :^D) pero... no es lo que recordaba. Los controles del primer juego daban asco, lo que antes era "realista y violento" ahora es ligeramente mas violento que minecraft con el mod de armas. En serio, el primer juego los modelos son jodidos cubos y manchas negras en el piso (sigue siendo disfrutable el primer juego, pero ñeh). SIN EMBARGO, en postal redux todo eso cambia!

PROS:
+ Mejores gráficas. Nada next-gen, pero definitivamente mejoró muchisimo mas que el primero.
+ Mejores controles. Ahora el uso del mouse es bueno :D puedes matar perfectamente sin tener que estar violando las flechas para mirar en solo 8 direcciones, ahora puedes ver a cualquier lado.
+ Mejores sonidos. La musica de fondo, las armas, las voces, todo ha sido reemplazado. Suena muchísimo mejor ahora, y le da un buen toque al gameplay <3

NEUTRALES:
/ Esto es un redux, no un remake. No hay nuevas armas, ni mapas. Solo mejoras en gameplay, video y sonido. Dicen los desarrolladores que en el futuro añadirán cosas como coop, mas mapas y otros modos de juego, pero por ahora (01/07/16) solo son mejoras pequeñas.
/ Las gráficas. A mi en lo personal me gusta mas un juego con gameplay hermoso a un juego que se vea hermoso. La verdad no me molestan los gráficos, pero probablemente no sea tu juego si te encanta algo que se vea como BF4.

CONTRAS:
- Menos sange, menos "palabrotas" y menos todo. Jugue postal (el original) hace un par de semanas, y podría jurar que hay mas sange, postal dude dice mas majaderías y las animaciones de "asesinato" eran mas brutales. Ahora el juego ha minimizado la cantidad de sangre, la animación de "asesinato" siempre es la misma, postal dude rara vez dice alguna palabrota, y los enemigos/ciudadanos ya no ruegan por su vida.
- El precio. Comparado con el bajo precio de postal y/o postal 2, esto es ridículo. En mi opinión, es bueno el juego, pero aún con un 50% de descuento al que lo he comprado se me hace mucho para el estado actual del juego. Por ahora, al menos hasta que añadan mas cosas, no recomiendo comprarlo a menos que esté en rebaja. El juego es bueno, pero el precio es ridículo.

En total, es un 7.5/10. Es bueno, pero es mas "soft" que el original, está sobrepreciado y por ahora solo tiene mejoras gráficas y de gameplay. No añade nada nuevo, pero aún así es un buen juego.
