23677844.review:
Now after beating the game I will give out my review.

Postal Redux is a remastering of the original postal game with updated graphics and controls. One thing I will mention is that the controls are much better than they were in the original postal. (Seriously they were shit in the original) 

Pros+
-Much better controls (even better shooting than the recent game Hatred)
-Decent variety of weapons
-We got good ol Rick Hunter reprising his role as the Postal Dude. (we even have Corey Burton who did the dude in Postal III narrating the ending.)
-Really messed up and awesome looking illustrations. (my Favorite is the one in the credits and in the main menu)
-a good handful of levels with more coming in a free update

Mixed opinions+/-
-while the shooting is very spot on it also means the enemies can't really miss shooting you unless they're throwing grenades, shooting rockets, or firing napalm launchers. It can make it hard not to die.
-Ignore this if you have been a fan of the Postal Series since the first Postal...but the tone here is much different than Postal 2. It seems to be focused on a much more gritty and twisted theme than offensive, low brow humor. (although I really don't have a issue with it. I enjoy dark stuff, but it can be a little surprising.)
-the graphics aren't the best, but I didn't have a issue with it. I know others might though, but it's freaking Postal so who cares XD.

Cons -
-Those god damn rocket turrents! They keep firing rockets non stop when your in their view which means they can keep blasting you and you keep getting knocked down. I can count at least 6 times I died thanks to this, and I know you can duck, but I didn't even have enough time to do that while the Postal Dude was getting up....plus ducking isn't helpful when your forced up against a god damn wall.

-The Air Force Base level. This level was complete bullshit to me since there were so many god damn swat officers and so many buildings where they come out of. Plus I had times where I forgot a guy south of me had a fucking napalm launcher which resulted in a cheap death because you have barely any control over the Dude when he's on fire! The only pro I have for this is that after this you get to the final level....and see a lot of messed up shit. So at least the payoff was worth it.

-The AI is dumb as rocks. Innocent civilians run around like idiots so it makes it hard to do a pacifist route when the civilians are too dumb to run away from the dude than running in circles.

-There are no subtitles.... I know there's not that much talking in Postal, but it's almost impossible to hear Corey Burton in the Ending due to the other sounds being much louder than him.

Verdict:

Postal Redux is a very good remastered version of the original Postal video game and for $15 dollars you can't go wrong. So if you wanted to get into the first game or you just want a decent amount of fun shooting pick this up. It's worth the money.

23620197.review:
[h1]The same good ol’ unnecessary violence.[/h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuhEoxzpvow

So, where to start? I was a bit skeptical at first, despite knowing that these devs won’t ever change, i was still a bit scared that any other Postal game after the first and the second ones will be less fun  and won’t be the same, because, to be honest, in the recent years the gaming community started getting very sensitive to certain aspects of violence. And i don’t like to say this, but we need to face the fact that violence is part of the human nature, of course, that doesn’t necessarily mean something good, and it surely doesn’t mean you should replace this kind of behavior in the real life. 
And i strongly believe it’s a good thing if developers (generally speaking) are adding such senseless violence, racism, and various other kinds of hatred. And please, don’t get me wrong, I am not racist, nor homophobic, i don’t believe in any of these intolerant groups, but these are things you see them in your daily life, they are everywhere, and i think we need to accept the fact that for the moment they are still a big thing, and i believe that trying to ignore them in movies and games doesn’t do anything good, on the contrary, we are running away from the ugly truth.
This is life, good and bad aspects, good and bad people.
Now, about Postal Redux, I was glad that i was proven wrong, nothing changed at the very core of Postal.
The game is polished, and it was improved alot graphically speaking, the VFX in this game are also eye-pleasing.


[b]Gameplay[/b]

You have a good variety of weapons and explosives to create mass chaos with, and each of them are very fun to use.

The difficulty option does its job pretty well, i tried the game in both the easiest difficulty and the hardest one, for example in the hardest difficulty, you might die once or twice every level until you figure out the best pathway to start your killing spree, and the difficulty option adds extra hostiles, changes some enemy types, and also changes how often you find health/guns/ammo.
Isometric games tend to be confusing at times, even the original Postal was a bit confusing. In this one it was slightly weird only when you were walking and having to shoot enemies from multiple directions at the same time, but i think this is not something unusual.

Also.. SECRETS! I personally loved when games had secret areas hidden throughout them, and i am glad this one has some aswell, they might not feel so rewarding as the ones in Duke Nukem 3D, let’s say, but it’s nice when you find them (not very hard). 

I think this is everything that could’ve been written at this section of the review, if you are familiar with Postal, you know it is a simplistic game with not a rich background story, but a rich and fun Shoot’Em Up experience.

What some people might not be very fond of, the actual playtime, for me it was around 1.6 hours, but as far as i know, the first one was also the same. 
On the bright side, you will probably love to replay this quite often.

Also, a new mode was added, Rampage, in which you you mantain killstreaks and try to get high scores, i still have yet to play it properly, but i am happy overall that they've added some new content to this great cocktail of insanity.


[b]Soundtrack[/b]
Not sure if this soundtrack fits Postal Redux as it should, but it is amazing.
It made me feel energic, it made me feel like i was going literally insane. I loved it! Unique, very dark and mysterious but also with a strong psychopathic vibe to it.

[h1]Ending note: I love this new remake, i am very happy that it didn’t change, i am happy the developers still work on the POSTAL ‘franchise’, and i am very glad i got the chance to play this. 

[b]Thank you, RWS.[/b][/h1]

23573403.review:
Postal Redux... Thank you RWS, I loved the original Postal so much. Postal 2 with it's humor and what not, I still love being the Postal Dude in serious moments. As late 90's PC games are becoming more and more of a migraine to run on a modern PC. I was struggling to keep playing the original Postal. Windows 10 almost killed it... Fucking Microshit...

Now this is a wonderful remake but I do have some issues with it...

Postives! 

+You get to play a homocidal maniac with no boundaries and just power hungry fantasy. Great stress reliever.
+Despite being power hungry dark fantasy, it has some challenge to it. Extreme challenges at times, Don't let the new modern controls deceive you if you played the Original. Despite aiming faster with a mouse instead of psuedo tank controls, those cops/S.W.A.T/ army can still kick your ass.
+Postal has some dark atmosphere that many loyal postal fans, like me, missed that Postal 2 sort of threw away for humor.
+The ending may have been altered to respect the families who lost their children in horrific acts but the ending was even more satisfying. It made me think and wonder even more then the original ending. RWS did not "chicken out" They wanted to respect greiving families... Kudos to you, RWS.
+The controls... It was a love letter... Being able to play this with mouse aiming then tank controls... @w@
+Optimization is outstanding! Except for little problem that I will touch upon in the negatives *Glares at!* The animation is so smooth and it is managing to maintain a very pleasent 60 FPS despite all the ongoing carnage ingame!
+The game manages to keep the original style while being revamped with 3d models and better graphics, a thing most remakes fuck up on. Despite the levels being almost copy and pasted, the 3d ingame models of the Dude and enemies that oppose him being 3D models this time instead of psuedo 3D sprites. It just blends so well together, maintaining that nostalgic feel of the original Postal.

Negatives...

-This will be fixed patch but the game loads everything after the RWS Splash art with no loading screen. Yeah, the entire game does all the loading at the beginning with minor loading screens in between. It just takes forever and you think the game is broken cause you just stare at a black screen. Give it a few moments and turn down the resolution in the opitions menu and you can easily play the game when you start it up. They will fix this in a post patch 1, with a loading screen and what not.---> !!!So don't let this discourage you!!! <---

-The rampage is challenging, I will give it that but the rating's seem a bit harsh. I go on a 72 killstreak with executioner bonuses and creativity. I still get a B-, like holy shit. Bit discouraging but thankfully RWS made it a game design rather then a requirment so acheivement whores like me won't go ballistic trying to get it.

-Weapon switching is a bit assed, I am on rampage going on a massive killing spree and I try to switch my SMG to keep it going by nailing some canon fodder civillians only for my RPG to still be equipped and blowing myself up and killing myself. The weapon switching is a bit clunky for a fast paced enviroment such as Rampage mode.

-Some levels are missing... I miss the grocery store, retirement rich people home levels. Like it is funny to kill a naked guy and postal dude saying "Oop, I ripped the birthday suit." I hope they bring these levels back in a later patch... Please RWS? <3

-Sound options do not save your settings. I know this is petty but when I play the game on speaker and turn it down, I kind of don't expect it when I put headphones on and I replay it while I am on skype voice chat with my buddies and "BOOOOMM EEERRRHHH GRAAAH" Blowing up my eardrums and making me jump all the way into my roof everytime.

Redux is a wonderful remake. RWS know how to develope a remake, I will even suggest to those to pick up this game if they do not know much about tweaking their PC's to run old games... Or not, buy them both and support RWS!!! They deserve it. Thank you for Postal Redux RWS... You failed to dissapoint me but keep surprising me with all the efforts. I never thought Postal 1 and 2 would be resurrected so brilliantly! Even if they weren't? No regrets, eh? Well, there is absolutely nothing to regret. So keep on postaling it up with the dudes and live everyday saying "I regret nothing."

23508322.review:
[h1] POSTAL Redux [/h1]

DISCLAIMER: I received this product for no cost for the purpose of reviewing. However, this does not affect my views and opinions of the game.

If you've played the original postal, then there might not be a whole lot for you in this review aside from the changes made [i] from [/i] the original. This is the first time I've played a Postal game despite owning "POSTAL" & "POSTAL 2" on Steam. This means I'll also be looking at the game from a mechanics point of view as well as it's play-ability. 

As many people already know, the Postal series has you as some dude, (appropriately named; "Postal Dude") shooting up civilians and any hostile enemies trying to end his rampage. The game is a 2D top downish-isometicish twin-stick shooter. The story is almost non-existent from what I can tell, but the blatant unprovoked violence was once something of controversy when the original game first came out. 

--------

[b] Graphics: 7 / 10 [/b]

I have looked at the graphics quality of the original game and have compared it to the redux version. I can say that there definitely was an improvement, which is to be expected. It's sharper and more polished than the original. It also accents more of the detail there is in the game. Without the comparison, and taking into account that it is an indie title, the visuals are still pretty decent. They aren't amazing, and really aren't on par with a lot of the other games coming out, though you could also say that making a redux version could not tamper with the actual visuals too much, as it's more of a "restoration" of the title. All in all, I do think it's fine, and the retroish style will also appeal to others. The game is not that demanding and seems to be optimized fine. It can run on almost any lower tier graphics card and CPU. 

--------

[b] Sound: 6 / 10 [/b]

I'm not entirely sure if the sound assets were changed or if there was a quality improvement to the original, though the game's soundtrack, gun noises, and one liners are decent. The sound assets are all a tad muffled, though I think it adds to the experience of the game, and somehow it fits. Although I'm not much into the metally rockish grunge kind of music that the soundtrack consists of, I can see how some people would enjoy it, and it does really compliment the game's theme. 

--------

[b] Mechanics: 6 / 10 [/b]

The game mechanics were not changed from the original game at all from what I can tell. You run around killing people. It's a very simple system. You have a certain amount people you have to kill before moving on to the next stage. You can pick up a variety of weapons that each need ammo (aside from the starting gun). You can pick up ammo and health in some stages. Knowing when to use which guns with certain enemies is also key, as some guns do more damage than others. The enemies also have they're own arsenal, so you have to be careful not to take too much damage from them, as well as avoid environmental obstacles like fires and barrels, although you can also use these to your advantage. Although simple, the mechanics are solid and get the job done. 

--------

[b] Final Personal Remarks: [/b]

As someone who never played the original, the game is decent. It has a few difficulty settings depending on how good you think you are at the game. It's not the kind of game I'm personally into, and I wasn't around when there was all the controversy surrounding the original. 23362687.review:
https://youtu.be/FBUpI38CzzQ
[i]Game:[/i] POSTAL Redux
[i]Genre:[/i] Isometric Shooter
[i]Developer:[/i] Running With Scissors
[i]Publisher:[/i] Running With Scissors
[i][u]Copy supplied by PCGN[/u][/i]

[b]POSTAL Redux[/b] is a remastered version of the 1997 isometric shooter developed and published by Running With Scissors. I played the original game multiple times (even with its outdated controls) and I love the FPS sequel. I can safely say that this is a remaster done right.

[h1]STORY[/h1]
Honestly, there is basically no story. You play as the Postal Dude, a guy who is fed up of the world and goes postal (which is, go on a killing spree). Compared to its sequels, this is much more bleak and depressing and neither funny nor satirical. However, it also isn't offensive and controversial just for the sake of it ([i]looking at you, Hatred[/i]).

[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
The game adopts the original isometric camera angle, and updates the look of the original art style, bringing back some good ol' nostalgia. Each level feels different from the other, ranging from city ghettos and mines, to carnivals and small towns with marching bands. The only thing that kinda looks outdated are the character models, and the environments do lack color variety, but it fits the grim tone that the game is going for like a glove.
What I would really like to see in a future update is a little bit more gore: right now there are only head exploding if you execute people with the shotgun and burned bodies if they got hit by fire. I would love to see gibs when you use the rocket launchers, or limb removals when a grenade goes off.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
The game is a twin-stick shooter with a simple goal: to kill every hostile in the level. You start off with a machine gun, and you slowly start acquiring an arsenal of death featuring shotguns, flamethrowers, rocket launchers, and even an all-new revolver. There are also civilians (and sometimes even animals) that can be killed, earning this game the title of [i]controversial[/i].
The controls are very smooth, especially compared to the original version: simply being able to aim and shoot using the mouse changes the entire game. There is also a new game mode called Rampage, which is a Score Attack mode with lots more civilians and enemies in the levels, encouraging the players to use different weapons and playstyles to get higher scores.

[h1]CHALLENGE[/h1]
The enemy AI is decent, and usually plays more on the defensive staying behind walls and covers instead of rushing towards the player. (On the higher difficulty levels especially), they deal a lot of damage, so keeping check of the location of every single health pack in the levels is paramount.

[h1]SOUND[/h1]
The updated soundtrack and sound effects are great: the hard-rock music pumping through the levels keeps the adrenaline up to 11, and the screams of agonising civilians who are about to get their head blown off by a shotgun blast are oh so satisfying.

[h1]REPLAYABILITY[/h1]
The game features the original 17 levels (with the ones from the expansion pack to be released later for free) and the new Rampage mode. Also, knowing the developers, the game will be constantly updated for years to come, and I wouldn't be surprised if they manage to add even more levels, Workshop support, multiplayer modes and even new DLC just like they did for the now 13-year-old POSTAL 2.

Overall, this is a very fun and satisfying twin-stick shooter with good replayability and with multiple updates to come. Highly recommended to fans of the genre and of the original game. And it definitely is better than Hatred.

[h1]La matanza isométrica de 1997 está de regreso
Y en su máxima gloria[/h1]
Nos metemos en la piel del [b]"Dude"[/b], un man enloquecido, quien piensa que todo el mundo es su enemigo, y debe eliminarlos. La tierra está sedienta de sangre, y [b]Dude[/b] debe alimentarla.

[b]Positivos:[/b]
+ Gráficos remasterizados en altísima definición, pero manteniendo el estilo de dibujo pintado a mano

El Edito: as of September 30th or something, the game has Co-op play, the special delivery expansion and the 2 japan levels packed into a new 6 level campaign, more voice lines including classic ones like "Has anybody seen my ear?", the greatest secret code ever, and overall better volume mixing. I am still open to performing the act of fellatio on anyone within RWS, except for whoever put bread in the toilet.

First off, if you don't know what the gameplay in Postal is like, its a slower paced twinstick shooter. It not blazing fast like Hotline Miami, nor is it some top down tactical shooter, but its also not a standard twinstick with a shitload of people being thrown at you, like Total Carnage or Smash TV. To describe it, I'd say its like a bunch of seperate scenarios being put together to make a cohesive level. Some levels are smaller or more populated and end up playing out as almost non stop fighting, as you inevitably will anger one crowd while fighting another. Other levels are more spacious and allow you to come up with a simple strategy to follow through on when you move in. Its a great mix of thinking before you act, and acting without thinking.

The improvements all around from the original Postal 1 are all welcome. The controls are smooth as silk, and you no longer need a controller to have twinstick style controls. Some weapon rebalancing is also present, and working with the new control scheme the gameplay has more skill and strategy to it rather than just "crawl forwards slowly and pray to fucking jesus you dont die." The overall sound design is fantastic once more, and the atmosphere is just as stellar as it was in the original game. Also you can wear the original Red Coat, or pink if you're feeling particularly gay like I do sometimes.

Currently though, one thing to remember is this game as of whenever this is being posted, the game is an investment. Right now you get a solid campaign that lasts different lengths of time depending on the difficulty (about 1 hour on normal, 3-4 on hard), and you get the rampage mode if you enjoy score attack type stuff. RWS has confirmed co-op, deathmatch, the expansion levels, brand new levels, iirc a nightmare mode difficulty, and potentially a few extra things if all goes well. RWS is really fuckin' passionate about Postal Redux and it shows with how much they're talking about it. RWS is a fantastic company and you are certainly going to get more content than there is in it right now. Hell if anything just buy the game to support RWS cause they're fucking awesome people.

also Mike J Vince Desi Toploader/Kamek I'm still open for performing the act of fellatio on you fellas. The rest of you at RWS I don't know who you are but I'll do it to you folks too if you want. Women are only allowed to pat me on the head however.

23265309.review:
tl;dr: Hatred: the good version

Well, after much hype in P2: Paradise Lost, Postal Redux has released.  And I've got to say, it's an awesome game.
For those who don't know, Postal Redux is a remake of Postal, a 1997 PC game.  You play as the Postal Dude, an archetypal mass murderer who snaps, arms himself and "goes postal".  Your goal is to murder a set amount of enemies in order to procede to the next stage.  In addition to the enemies are unarmed civilians, who you can choose to gun down or spare at your discretion.  To put it simply, Postal Redux plays like an arcade shooter (think Robotron or Smash TV).  The original Postal had some unique concepts, including hand drawn backgrounds and a disturbing view into the mind of a spree killer; however, it was marred by god awful controls, difficulty spikes and poor sound quality.  Thankfully, Postal Redux remedies these problems. While keyboard and mouse controls are still a bit bizarre, the controls are excellent with a joystick.  The visuals have been updated, and while the 3D models aren't triple A quality, the backgrounds are still illustrated nicely.  New content has also been added, including the highly powerful revolver, a carnival stage (with armed clowns!), and the new "Rampage" mode, which is a score attack, arcade-y mode focused on combo kills, variety and speed (complete with great music).
While these revisions and additions are great, the game right now has one key issue: length.  Beating the campaign on hard takes a few hours at most, and as of right now, there's no multiplayer.  The Special Delivery maps and Super Postal maps are also missing.  However, multiplayer and new maps will be added in free updates in the future (according to Running With Scissors).
All in all, Postal Redux is an interesting game, much like the original Postal.  As wrong as it may seem to some, there's something I find therapeutic about gunning a group of digital people down, and thankfully, this is what Redux does best.  While the game is good, it's lacking in content currently, so if you have reservations about the game's length, wait for RWS to update it, or wait for a sale.  If you aren't a fan of psychological horror games or senseless murder, you may want to stay clear of this one: if you're a fan of the Postal series, psychological horror games, arcade shoot 'em ups, an angsty teenager, someone who likes to attack random pedestrians in Grand Theft Auto, or all of the above, I'd definetly recommend Postal Redux.

>inb4 "Hatred clone"
>inb4 CRAWLING IN MY FORESKIN

23211220.review:
Holy hell RWS you sure know how to make me interested in your games. 

I got into the POSTAL series very late. I received POSTAL 2 from a friend only a couple years ago. I played POSTAL 1 shortly after falling in love with POSTAL 2, and once Paradise Lost came out I was in love again. But then, once I'd played Paradise Lost as much as I could, I fell out of the loop again. Until recently anyway.

POSTAL Redux is an HD remake of the game that started it all, POSTAL. And I couldn't possibly be happier to say that it's nothing short of amazing.

Positives:
+Rick Hunter. I don't care if this is a cop out. He has a voice of gold, and as long as he lives, The Dude will live.

+It kept it's dark humor. When I see games based on "Dark humor" I always get worried what they mean by that. Do they mean that they occasionally make a slightly offensive joke, or do they do it RIGHT. POSTAL managed to do it right, and Redux kept it. When you pull a flamethrower out and hear the words "Need a light?", or pull a revolver out and hear The Dude laugh, you know that it's just good.

+They actually added stuff as well ISN'T THAT FUNNY FOR A SUPPOSED REMAKE. No but seriously, a lot has been added, like a new ending, the ability to change your character to multiple separate colors, even back to the ORIGINAL Red Trenchcoat, a completely new game mode called rampage which is basically the rampage missions from the early GTA games in which you kill as many people as you can and count your score. Then there's my favorite, they added executions for all the different weapons. Now you're no longer restricted to executing with the M16/SMG, now you can execute them all with them all.

+They fixed the controls. The original POSTAL controlled like a no armed man trying to use a chainsaw. AKA IT DIDN'T. The controls in Redux are now smooth, and best of all: PLAYABLE

Negatives:
-I have had the occasional bug. LIKE THE ONE WHERE AN ENEMY ROCKET KILLED AN INNOCENT AND IT COUNTED AS AN INNOCENT CASUALTY AND THEREFORE I LOST MY "NO INNOCENT CASUALTIES" BAR AND I WAS NO LONGER AVAILABLE FOR THE NO INNOCENTS KILLED ENDING AND I JUST HAPPENED TO BE BLOWN INTO THE EXIT WHEN I HAD ENOUGH KILLS SO THERE WAS NO DAMN WAY FOR ME TO KILL MYSELF AND RESTART AND THEREFORE I LOST 13 LEVELS WORTH OF KILLING NO INNOCENTS AND DYING BECAUSE I ACCIDENTALLY HIT ONE OR I TRIED TO AVOID ONE.

Вобщем, 10 часов, все достижения, умер за всё время раз 6 (по глупости, или хренового дизайна карт или багов), напряга с трудностью небыло. 
Итого: Ну. Блин, Зачем этот редукс сделали ясно. Тут 2 стороны медали. С одной - деньги нужны всем, и заработать на переиздании классики (которая и в оригинале работает и играется прекрасно) - сам бох велел. С другой - ну ок, мы думаем о фанах, которые любят первую часть, переиздать её на нью движке, облегчить управление, добавить мультиплеер с воркшопом (в разработке) - дать глотка свежего воздуха фанатам. Вот ток проблема, что ни мультиплеера ни воркшопа пока нет, дух оригинала держит всё это дело с натяжкой (серьёзно, послушайте крики и страдания в оригинале, да и нотки треков как то напряжнее звучат), а ввиду смены управления игра просто превратилась в лайтовый аналог Хейтреда. Только вот Хейтред играется веселее, и я не знаю стоит ли винить за это Редукс. Ведь это не ремейк ведь даже, а тупо смена движка, хотя и поменяли управление, цель и уровни оставили прежними, где то даже расширив.  
Кароче, верни игре ту жестокость, которая творилась в оригинале (а именно крики, страдания), добавить какого то реального вызова, да и попросту сделать её увлекательной - и всё будет отлично. 23177577.review:
This is a great remake of one of my favorite games
+The best feature is the controls, they feel amazing when compared to the old game
+The graphics are in the same style as the original, you can see the difference when playing on high (I play on high on my desktop), but I play on low on my laptop and it looks just like the original, just with new animations which is nice
+You can now execute people using every weapon which makes executions feel so much more satisfying (thanks RWS) 
+Rampage Mode - This mode has fun arcade-like Postal action
+There is a new weapon and new map, both of which are great, and the fact that we might see custom maps/content soon with workshop support is nice too

I only have two complaints
-The pedestrians seem to scream in terror a lot less in Redux then they do in the original Postal
-The new ending, while it was really dark/confusing/messed up as fuck, I still prefer the original ending with the school shooting and think it could have been expanded on in this, mainly because the thing I love about Postal games is how they push boundaries. However, I understand why RWS would choose to change the ending, to make it a lil less messed up, I just hope someone adds the original ending back in when workshop support is out

Overall, if you liked the original Postal you will LOVE Redux
If you like Postal 2 and Haven't tried the original, I recommend playing this to see Postal from its roots (it will probably feel like a very arcade-ish postal game to people who only played the second game (which is why I love Redux so much))

Redux feels just like a modernised version of the old game, especially with the updated controls 100/10

23175520.review:
After waiting for this game to come out since the moment it was announced, I'd say that my opinions about POSTAL Redux are a bit mixed. I like this game, but I wanted to love it. Here are the pros and cons.

Pros:
*Better gameplay than the original, it plays like an actual 3/4 isometric shooter, no-more tank controls.

*Rampage mode is awesome, especially that alternate ending!

*The new remastered OST is amazing, I just wish that all of them were remastered and not just most. Also amazing are the tracks for Rampage mode

*The levels are even more gorgeous than the originals, and I like how animated they are with car lights flicking on and off and flies around garbage, among other things.

*The new revolver and carnival levels are awesome, I love shooting clowns!

Cons:
*Biggest one, the new ending. I understand why RWS changed the original ending, but what they replaced it with is just boring. The original ending sequence with the school kids was shocking and gut wrenching, it left me shivering by the time the credits rolled. Here, the ending is just...I don't get it. Why is he at a grave? Why is he fainting? The original ending had an obvious meaning showing the depths of the P. Dude's madness, here I have no clue what's going on. And as much as RWS may deny it, they certainly did change it because of outside influence, Vince Desi even says as much in their recent Playboy interrview. 

* The new cutscene art is a mixed bag. While they're certainly faithful recreations, I feel they're too smooth, too digital. Maybe this is due to tech limits of computer screens in '97, but the original artworks had texture to them, they all looked gritty and acidic, like you'd burn your hand if you reached out and touched them. In Redux, some of the art is amazing, like the Construction Site and Trailer Park, but others like the Parade and the Mine look cartoonish, almost like they're from a children's story book. I wish RWS had gotten Randy Briley, the original artist from '97, to do remakes of his old work.

* Weapons need for umph to them, right now they're rather unexciting to use. They need to sound louder, deadlier, they ought to push the player back, have recoil, feel like actual guns. Also, they oughta be balanced more in terms of when the player gets them. Halfway through the game the player already has most weapons. 


I suppose that's it, besides some misc. glitches which I'm sure RWS will fix through patches. Like I said, mixed feelings, but I'd go so far as to say that if you love the POSTAL series and wanna support RWS and don't mind the cons listed above, go ahead and buy it.

23161734.review:
«I regret nothing».

Жестокость уже давно заняла своё почётное место в индустрии развлечений, будь то игры или кино. Некоторые из них достигли пика популярности благодаря скандалам, основанным на беспричинной жестокости и безудержном насилии над людьми. Ярким примером может стать Hatred от польских разработчиков, хайп вокруг которой был поднят нехилый, а сама игра на деле оказалась чрезвычайно скучной и безыдейной. 

В далёком 1997 году вышел изометрический 3D-шутер под названием POSTAL, который отличался чрезмерной жестокостью и довольно необычными игровыми механиками. Игра являлась дебютной для разработчиков из Running With Scissors и была создана на их собственные деньги. Получилось всё для того времени очень даже хорошо: на волне популярности были выпущены аддоны с новыми локациями, режимами и противниками. В 2003 вышел сиквел – Postal 2, который являлся шутером от первого лица и обладал ещё большим количеством жестокости, безумия и чёрного юмора.

Пару лет назад был анонсирован ремейк первой части игры на движке Unreal Engine 4. Игра увидела свет спустя два года и сказать, что время, потраченное на разработку ремейка ушло впустую, язык не поворачивается. Это всё тот же мясной «Постал» о «чуваке», который одним прекрасным солнечным утром решил устроить массовый геноцидный поход против человечества. Начнёт он это, пожалуй, с собственных соседей – не стоило прошлой ночью включать музыку слишком громко.

Главный герой «Чувак» - это абсолютно хладнокровный, сумасшедший тип в плаще, который всю свою беззаботную жизнь вынашивал план о кровавом походе против людей, и, наконец, дождался своего часа. Хотя, убийства для него – это, скорее, развлечение, ибо ничто, кроме как испуганные, окровавленные и дрожащие от ужаса лица жертв, не приносит ему такого удовольствия и удовлетворения.

Каждый из семнадцати уровней – это отдельная, не похожая на другую локация, со своими собственными декорациями и уникальным стилем оформления. «Чувак» пройдёт свой путь через такие места как трейлерный парк, гетто, пригород и, наконец, военная база. На каждом уровне нужно уничтожить определённый процент вооруженных людей. Помимо них, на локации также обитают безобидные гражданские и животные, убийство которых особо ни на что не влияет.

Противники отличаются, в основном, внешним видом и вооружением: от простых полицейских до тяжеловооруженных бойцов спецназа. А вот у Чувака под плащом может находиться одновременно десять видов оружия: от пистолета-пулемёта и классического шотгана до гранатомёта и РПГ. Также никто не отменял мины, гранаты и коктейли молотова.
Что касается графики и звука, в редукс версии всё сделано неплохо. Каждое здание, противник или визуальный эффект выполнены аккуратно, без потери духа игры девяносто седьмого года. Данный ремастер является образцом качества в плане сохранения и улучшения того, что было раньше, хотя сам по себе не привносит ничего принципиально нового и уникального.

После прохождения кампании, которое займёт у вас около двух часов, развлекаться предстоит в режиме «Бойня». Эдакое испытание на прочность, в котором предстоит проходить уровни как можно быстрее, убивая как можно чаще и с минимальным интервалом. Кроме того, разработчики обещают выпустить в скором времени апдейт, который добавит в игру подобие кооператива и мультиплеера – это, пожалуй, единственное, чего POSTAL Redux не хватает в данный момент.

Конечно, нельзя не провести аналогию с Hatred – духовным наследником Постала. Игра хоть и получилась банально однообразной и надоедающей через двадцать минут, но отрицать то, что в ней есть стиль и присутствует отличный визуальный ряд, никак нельзя. В POSTAL Redux с этим дела обстоят несколько хуже. Он, конечно, имеет свой стиль, пришедший прямиком из девяносто седьмого года, но он является менее привлекательным для текущего поколения игроков. В остальном – работа проделана отличная, POSTAL стал выглядеть и играться намного лучше, чем версия девяностых годов.

A twin stick shooter with attitude. Fans of the original POSTAL will love this updated version complete with new modes.

Game Details:
The classic dark and surreal twin-stick isometric shooter returns with a vengeance! 

POSTAL Redux is a high definition remake of The Postal Dude's infamous first foray into the world. Prepare to experience his psychological journey with faithfully recreated high resolution visuals, remastered music, sounds, and dialog, and revamped and modernized gameplay. Crazed gunmen out for your blood await you around every corner. The only choice is clear: Get them before they get you. Fight back with a devastating arsenal as you make your way through a violence-stricken town. 

It's time to relive the madness of GOING POSTAL!

23152903.review:
И так переиздание первого Постала.Ждал его еще с момента анонса и после того,как страница игры появилась в steam стал откладывать деньжата.И вот 21 мая он вышел.
Сразу плюсы.
1-Управление.Одназночно управление стало гораздо удобнее(на все 100%).Но из-за этого пострадала сложность игры.Игру прошел на hard е и сложно лишь было на последних 2-ух уровнях.
2-Атмосфера безумия.Тут и так все понятно(это же Постал).
3-Анимированный загрузочный экран.Это не такой уж и большой плюс,но тоже идет в копилку.
4-Цена.Игра стоит в полной сумме 200 Рублей.И она себя вполне  окупает.
5-Переход на уровни.(Это тоже не такой уж и большой плюс,но все же как и в случае с 3 плюсом идет в копилку.)Если в оригинале нужно было нажать f1(1997 год все дела).То здесь нужно идти в какую-то определенную точку,дабы завершить уровень.
6-Озвучка и звуки.В отличии от оригинала в игре качественный звук.И Чувак говорит голосом Чувака(как это бы странно не звучало,думаю вы поняли.)И музыка в главном меню,особенно добавляет атмосферы безумия.
7-ИИ.На мой взгляд местные болванчики ведут себя адекватно,по сравнению с оригиналом.
8-Оружие.Оружия здесь больше,чем в оригинале.
9-Поддержка контроллера.Тут все ясно.
10-Концовка.Концовку переделали.(Не буду говорить на какую,пройдете и увидите.Не люблю спойлерить)
Насчет графики...Игра сделана на Unreal Engine 4.И графика в этой игре.И не плохая и не хорошая.Эффекты выглядят хорошо,да и модели прорисованы хорошо.
Теперь к минусам.Он тут один:
Продолжительность.Игру можно спокойно пройти за час(на easy или на NormaL),если хотите задержаться в игре ставьте hard или запустите режим rampage.
Подводя итог,хочу сказать,что RWS действительно постарались сделать отличный redux(прислушивались к мнениям игроков и все-такое)И у них это получилось.Надеюсь,что RWS сделают redux второго Постала и переделают убогий третий Постал(который угробила не RWS,а Аккела).Рекомендую брать(особенно фанатам Постала(коим я и являюсь))
8.5/10.
Надеюсь кому-то было интересно читать мой обзор.Играйте только в хорошие игры.P.S.Hatred-это калька с Постала(причем не очень хорошого качества,в отличии от Постала(1997-ого года)).И еще один P.S.Надеюсь в последующих патчах добавят co-op.
В августе вышел патч в котором добавили co-op...

Any fan of the original Postal should definitely check this out and support the devs. 

It's a good update to the classic, fixing a lot of the problems the original had, mainly playability. Some updated graphics make the game easier on the eyes. that and a few tweaks to the interface make it easier to tell what's going on, and make the game easier to play overall. 

Players new to the series might find it difficult to get into, as it's still a top-down shooter from nearly twenty years ago. Even so, this is a classic that I would suggest to anyone.

23143024.review: First off I would like mention that this game (and also original POSTAL) are very different from POSTAL 2, while POSTAL 2 was a political satire game POSTAL and POSTAL Redux are very different... So what is POSTAL Redux? POSTAL Redux is a high definition remake of original POSTAL. In this game you take control of guy named Postal Dude who (as his name suggests) is going postal. Your objective here is simple: Kill anyone who stands in your way before he can kill you. You can choose from wide variety of weapons that have been in original POSTAL, but also whole new revolver weapon. You have chance to see 17 levels from POSTAL remastered in high definition, including a new level called Carnival.  The game now of course has much better sound quality and also HD loading screens art, HD sprites and HD levels background. Oh and the controls are now [b] much [/b] better, while the controls in original POSTAL felt kind of clumsy, in this game they are pretty nice... So will you like this game? Well that's very subjective, so I can't really tell for sure but if you are fan of POSTAL or similar games i think you may like it and even if you haven't played POSTAL (or any other game from Postal series) i still recommend you to at least give it a shot and see if you like it.

23141440.review: I really loved the game. I played it for 5 hours for the past two days! Thank you RWS for making this game. The Rampage Mode was amazing and the Campaign was very well done too.

Самой важной новинкой является кооператив, расчитанный на 4-х игроков. Очень интересная задумка, а главное сетевой режим является прекрасным дополнением. Теперь точно будет веселей зачищать локации.

23140591.review:
Na początek może wspomnę że w pierwszego Postal'a oczywiście grałem..
Jest to bardzo dobra gra jak na swoje czasy jednak sterowanie nie jeat zbyt wygodene. Mimo to przeszedłem całą grę wraz z dodatkami Special Delivery i Japanse Levels z zacieszem na mordzie gdy pixelowa lrew lała się z ekranu.

Jedną z najlepszych rzeczy w Postal Redux jest nowe, wygodne celowanie za pomocą celownika. Granie w tą grę est teraz o wiele przyjemniejsze.
Można teraz zmieniać broń za pomocą kółka myszy a granaty rzucamy na PPM.
(W Postal'u były one jako osobna broń)

Grafika nadal ma ten sam rysunkowy styl oryginału <3, dodano efekty światła, cieni, wody oraz animowane obiekty np. Powiewająca flaga, dym z komina itd. Zadbano nawet o takie drobiazgi jak dzwięki strzelania w auta, drzewa, szyby i inne obiekty, modele zostały zaktualizowane i wyglądają o wiele lepiej niż w pierwszym Postalu. Jednak nadal to wszystko nie jest na poziomie najnowszych gier ale... myślę że to było zamierzone przez twórców aby zachować ten Postalowy klimat... lub poprostu twórcy nie mieli kasy XD

Egzekucje można wykonywać teraz z każdej broni. Co powiecie na rozwalanie głów shotgunem, miażdżenie głów wyrzutnią raket lub palenie żywcem konających ofiar miotaczem ognia? 
(to co wymieniłem to nie wszystkie rodzaje egzekucji)

Grając na trybie trudności "Hard" zamiast psychopatycznych tekstów typu "Ziemia jest głodna..." zobaczymy pamiętnik Kolesia ujawniający prawdziwą fabułę gry. Tak Postal 1 ma fabułę jednak wiele osób o tym nie wie ponieważ pamiętnik był dołączany tylko do oryginalnej angielskiej pudełkowej wersji Postal 1.

W grze mamy 4 tryby gry:
"Campaign" - czyli zwykłą kampanię. 
"Super Delivery" - Remake dodatków "Special Delivery" zawierającego 4 dodatkowe poziomy oraz specialnego japońskiego wydania "Super Postal" zawierającego 2 nowe japońskie poziomy.
"Rampage" - w którym naszym zadaniem jest zdobycie jak największej lidżby punktów a w tle słyszymy muzykę, bardzo dobrą muzykę.
"COOP" - Tryb kooperacji w którym moźemy przejść kampanię razem z przyjaciółmi.


Jeśli chodzi o nowości to naszego arsenału trafią wszystkie bronie znane z P1 oraz nowy Rewolwer, 2 nowe mapy: Karnawał oraz nowe zakończenie, Nowe loadingscreeny, zremasterowana muzyka oraz możliwość wyboru koloru płaszcza od czarnego aż po różowy (^ ^,)
Dzięki tej opcji gracze przyzwyczajeni do pierwszej wersji P1 mogą ustawić sobie znany im czerwony kolor.

Gra sama w sobie jest świetna, jednak brak Wyzwań (zbieranie flag itd. które były w P1), Multiplayera oraz Edytora Poziomów jest nieco rozczarowujący. Mam nadzieję że się kiedyś tego doczekamy.

Jeśli pojawi się promocja -70% lub więcej możecie kupywać bez obaw bo warto wydać te pare ojro na kilkanaście godzin świetnej zabawy w starym dobrym klimacie pierwszego PSOTALA! B)

PS. Mimo że gra nie wygląda na wymagającą to jest na silniku Unreal Engine 4 i ma dość wysokie wymagania jak na swój wygląd... więc jeśli macie trochę słabszy sprzęt sprawdzcie najpierw wymagania.

23117372.review:
[h1]Notice: this is probably the first and only serious, full length review I'll write for a game, since this game deserves it.[/h1]

[b]The blessed are the meek, for they make easy targets[/b]

[i]Postal Redux[/i] does a near perfect job on what it wants to be, a twin stick shooter where you gun down as many people as possible. While the gameplay never really evolves past just shooting dudes, different weapons and level layouts keep the experience interesting.

Postal Redux is more than just a graphical update, it improves the weapons, controls, enemy AI... everything. For example: In the original Postal only a couple of weapons actually felt useful and did decent damage. In Postal Redux all of the weapons serve a purpose, others are better at clearing out hordes of enemies and others are better at taking down strong individuals. Even the originally pointless mines are actually useful now!

However even though the game is near perfect, there are still flaws. The screen is a bit too small and there's no way to look around like in for example: Hotline Miami, so there will be times where the enemy gets some free hits on you from off-screen. Original Postal did not have this problem since the enemies had admittedly bad AI, but here since they're so much smarter, you end up in some frustrating situations at times.

But all that aside Postal Redux is a fantastic game and I highly recommend it to anyone who thinks they would like some old fashioned mass murder.



And fuck, it's still better than Hatred.

初代をやった以来なので15年ぶりくらいにプレイしましたが面白いです。
どうにもFPSとかオープンワールドとか肌に合わないみたいなんですが、こうした閉じた空間のクォータービューのゲームってなんだかホッとします。

こんなところにアイテムが、という宝探しが面白いです。

23109411.review:
First off, I would like to congradulate Running With Scissors for not making a top down shooter that controlled like a tricycle missing one of the wheels. On a serious note, the control is FAR better than what the original POSTAL had. This time around, I was able to ambush and bomb rush the enemies that are out for my blood. With the new controls, I was able to dodge missles and other projectiles more easily than in the original game. As for the presentation, the hand drawn stages look really nice and mesh well with the 3D models of the characters. Another thing that I liked was the wide variety of NPC's that you can kill and the animations that play when they're not quite dead yet.  I also enjoyed the inclusion of the revolver, as it allowed me to kill most enemies with one hit. Additionally, the new Rampage mode is tons of fun, as I found it thrilling to gun down as many people as I could in the area around me.

Although I find POSTAL Redux a good game, I have some issues. First off, although I praised the presentation earlier, sometimes dead bodies clip through the various objects in the scenery, which kind of bothered me. Another thing I didn't like is how they didn't elaborate of Postal Dude's background and why he's doing this whole thing in the first place. Instead, the game just throws you into the action after the title card for the level. Additionally, I disliked how the enemies in the stages didn't really try to come after you once the level started. Instead, they would stand around until you approached them or shot them while they were standing there. Finally, I don't like how the game doesn't elaborate on who the people at the end of the game are, as it leaves us wondering who are the people keeping the Dude locked up.

Despite all this, I find POSTAL Redux to be far superior to the original game that came out in 1997. If you are a fan of the POSTAL series, top-down shooters, and shooting everything in your path, than this game is for you. If this doesn't quite tickle your fancy, check out POSTAL 2 instead.

My final score is a 8/10

Ich LIEBE dieses Remake!
Es fühlt sich genau so an wie das aller erste Postal und versetzt vorallem die in Nostalgie, die es früher schon gespielt haben.
Erinnert sich noch jemand wie verboten man sich gefühlt hat, dieses für die Zeit wirklich brutale Spiel zu spielen in dem man auf den ersten Blick nichts anderes macht als in isometrischer Ansicht einen sinnlosen Amoklauf unternimmt in dem man Gegner wie Zivilisten gleichermaßen mit diversen Methoden das Lebenslicht auspusten kann?
Nur mit vorgehaltener Hand wurde über Postal, dass Tabu brechende Game, geredet und es war generell ein Akt es legal als Teenie beschaffen zu können.
All diese Gefühle erheben sich nochmal nach vielen Jahren und man schwelgt in den Erinnerungen.
Doch nicht nur Fans und Nostalgiefreunde werden hier auf ihre Kosten kommen.

Dank der verbesserten Grafik und der generell super Umsetzung des alten Knochens, werden auch alle anderen, welche zumindest ein wenig auf Twin-Stick-Shooter stehen, ihren Spaß haben.
Es fühlt sich einfach extrem rund an, hat eine gute Anzahl an Waffen und Granaten, bis jetzt auch noch ohne Bugs und die Level sind sehr detailreich gezeichnet.
Der Sound ist gut wobei die kultige Stimme des Postal-Guys und seine bitterbösen Kommentare natürlich besonders hervorstechen.
Außerdem, wer will nicht mal seine sadistischen Neigungen an pixeligen Männchen ausleben? ;)

Der Preis hätte etwas billiger sein können im Vergleich zu anderen Twin-Stick-Shootern der Neuzeit aber trotzdem sind knapp 15€ noch vollkommen OK für das Game.
Solltet ihr es für 10€ und weniger bekommen dann greift ruhig ohne Bedenken zu.

Ich wünsche viel Spaß beim Amoklauf!

Special Delivery and Multiplayer is planned and will be released once it's ready.

If you are a fan of Postal and Postal 2 what are you waiting for just buy it, and have a ball, because this game is well worth it. Hatred players come on and give this game a try too. For anyone that loves twin-stick shooters give it go as well, because this game is perfect for you. For anyone else that may be new to the Postal series just give it a go and see if you like it.

23105239.review:
POSTAL Redux is a loving recreation of an old cult classic that harkens back to the heyday of isometric shooters. The newly remastered art is fantastic and really makes the colors pop. A new Carnival level takes advantage of the new 1080p style with lots of colors and high resolution art. Not to mention the much improved controls. It controls beautifully now, a massive improvement upon the original which was one of my biggest gripes of it.

Along with this, Redux adds a new Rampage mode that is very fun and fast paced. It is a score based mode which rewards fast and creative gameplay. The new Revolver weapon also packs a satisfying punch and Rick Hunter's sexy voice is still the stuff of legends. 

Unfortunately, the game is not quite finished yet. A co-op multiplayer mode will be coming some time which I am sure will be great fun for friends who want to go postal. Along with this, the DLC maps for Special Delivery will be remastered and released in a future free update for Redux.

That being said, I don't know why the old ending was replaced with this new one other than the old ending was too controversial even for RWS to redo. This is a shame as the original ending level was one of the most shocking moments I ever faced in a video game, and the new ending leaves no impact other than a big "huh?"

Botched ending aside, POSTAL Redux is still a very well done remake, but I say wait a bit until either the multiplayer and DLC maps get added or there is a sale to purchase it.  Also PLEASE add Steam Workshop upport.

23104229.review:
If you loved the original Postal, you'll love this.

If you love Postal 2, give the first Postal a look before buying, it's a completely different type of game.

If you don't know what Postal is, keep reading.

Postal was released in 1997 and created a ton of controversy for it's violence. Sure, it may be tame by todays standards, but back then, this game was targeted by tons of groups. It wasn't that the game was bloody (though it is), but the manner in which the violence is depicted. Roughly 1/3 of the people you get ot kill in this game are civillians. Some of them will crawl along the ground after being shot, saying things like "I can't feel my legs". It does paint a pretty disturbing, if a bit darkly humorous, picture. 

So what's it all about?

That's almost a mystery. What we know is, there's a guy named "Postal Dude" who is evicted from his home and is getting shot at by the authorities. If you read the manual, he believes a large portion of the population in his town have some sort of sickness. However, in-game, the messages before the levels are just bleak and sometimes downright evil. Aside from these messages, there isn't much to go on. As such, you can draw up tons of conclusions in this game. That's one of the things that makes it so intriguing (as well as the atmosphere in general). The whole game takes on a very, again, disturbing tone. Not quite Manhunt level of disturbing, but it can still be pretty unsettling. 

The game is played from a top-down perspective. It controls, now, like a modern twin-stick shooter. Each level has a set number of people you have to kill (or you can opt to kill the entire population on the stage). Once you kill enough, the exit will open. It's a fairly short experience. Each level will take 4-5 minutes to clear (with the later stages taking a bit longer, obviously). There are 17 stages in all, as well as a Rampage mode where you try and string together kills to get a high score. 

Gameplay-wise, the game is simple. You point, you shoot, you walk, you shoot some more, you pick up more weapons and health, repeat this until the level ends. It's simple, and pretty fun, but it does wear thin pretty quickly (the game will be over before you're completely bored with it, though). The AI isn't particularly smart, but it does seem like some of the pathfinding issues have been ironed out since the original.

Graphics-wise, the game looks fantastic when compared to the original. I thought that the newer character models did give it an overall more "cartoony" feel, but it's still a great upgrade. The redrawn maps are beautiful, and everything is animated nicely. However, if you don't know what to expect from the original Postal, this game will still look extremely dated if you're expecting a modern-looking game.

Some of the sounds have been revamped, but most of the levels are still devoid of any kind of music. You still get the creepy ambient sounds, the great environmental sounds, and all the other good stuff, but I really wish that RWS would have composed some tracks for the campaign. Rampage mode does have music, and it's very up tempo and fits in with the gameplay.  

Overal, Postal Redux accomplishes what it wanted to. It updated the graphics, gameplay, and overall experience of the original Postal. Is Postal still a good game to play in 2016? It's definitely fun in small doses, but it does come off as very primitive these days. I still enjoy myself, but I can understand how someone would favor newer twin-stick shooters over this game. 

+ Graphical overhaul
+ New weapons
+ Rampage mode
+ Still as atmospheric as ever
+ Revamped controls

- Short
- Very basic when compared to newer games of its kind

For fans of the original Postal: 9/10 (doesn't include expansion levels)
For newcomers: 6/10

It would have been a bit higher, but $15 for this game, if you've never played Postal and don't exactly know what you're getting into, it might seem a bit steep. It's a definite purchase at <$10

23103198.review:
Hands down one of THE best games of the year! About as good as Fallout 4.

Ever played POSTAL back in '97? Loved the shit out of it? Wished you could go back to it, but a little, I dunno, more "modern" and "aych-dee"? Is that how you kids say it?

no really is it please help

Get to do the same all over again, except this time you've got some new tricks up your sleeve. Hoo boy, RWS have been busy...Not just with POSTAL 2 either, highly recommend you pick that up as well.

The detail they put into reworking each and every one of the original levels is staggering, and very faithful to the original. New weapons, like the Revolver, and old classics such as the Napalm Launcher, Spray Cannon, and Landmine, give you a nice tactical advantage over the people who want you dead, that is, everyone with a gun. 

If you're feeling bored of the Campaign, there's always the Rampage mode. Always a fun way to kill some time and work off some stress. And if you still ain't satisfied, then there's a Co-Op mode. Drag along up to three friends (provided you can find some, if not, then there's a Clown AI mode) for the ride!

You also get to change the Postal Dude's coat, from the standard black, to the classic (and I DO mean classic) red, to even pink, so pick your favourite color! Show off some pride while you're at it!

Highly recommended. And, as always, have no regrets.

40771679.review:
В 2014 году был анонсирован Hatred, духовный наследник первого Postal. Игра сразу же привлекла к себе огромное количество внимания. Уровень жестокости в трейлере просто зашкаливал. Кто-то даже шептал про переворот в индустрии, но… не получилось, не фортануло. Продукт оказался слишком сырым. Postal не был побит, но задуматься об этом стоило.

RWS смекнули, что их старичок не такой уж и бессмертный и что пора бы его чуть обновить, дабы держать планку и заодно напомнить людям об одной американской идиоме – «Going postal». Так в 2016 году вышел ремейк первой части под названием Postal: Redux. 

По сути основа осталась все той же. Мы играем за Чувака, который в один прекрасный зимний день съехал с катушек и, выйдя из дома с автоматом наперевес, отправился мочить всех кого увидит. В качестве противников выступают обычные полицейские, отряды специального назначения, военные и ополченцы. Естественно не обошла стороной игра и мирный люд, который, впрочем, убивать и не обязательно. Хотите накормите своего внутреннего маньяка, хотите нет, тут уж решать вам. 
Вы спросите, в чем собственно отличие от оригинала? А отличий тут много.

Для начала скажу, что игра была полностью переработана и перерисована с нуля. Движок сменили на более современный Unreal Engine 4, что принесло возможность использовать новую картинку и анимацию. Понятное дело, что после такого все модельки и локации пришлось делать заново. И сделаны они очень недурно – разрешение увеличилось, а цвета стали сочнее.
Атмосфера игры при таких масштабных изменениях не пострадала. Я скажу больше – она даже стала еще более психоделической. В этом помогают загрузочные экраны. Их тоже перерисовали, анимировали, накинули жутких звуков и добавили мыслей главного героя, которые иногда бывает читать немного жутковато. Если вы волнуетесь за ту самую мозговыносящую музыку из главного меню, не стоит, новая версия, конечно, звучит чуточку хуже, но в целом вполне себе достойная и вписывается в общую картину. Касаемо остальных звуков, их также не обошли стороной. Все они были заменены, но вот некоторые идут прямиком со второй части. Была ли это отсылка или банальная экономия средств, мне неизвестно.

Изменилось управление, мы были лишены проблем оригинала. Более того, управление теперь можно настроить самому, а если вы любитель извращений, то и вовсе подключить геймпад. Из мелочи могу вспомнить более разнообразный арсенал вооружения, дополнительные игровые уровни и иная концовка. Ах да, нелепую кнопочку F1 также убрали :)

Насколько мы знаем, современной игре тяжело без мультиплеерной составляющей. RWS не подвели и тут, кооперативный режим к вашим услугам, дело за малым – найти столь же больного на голову друга.

Что ж, похоже просто перерисовать текстурки было слишком легко и неинтересно. Мы не увидели уже классический высeр HD издания, это нечто большее, это полное переосмысление первой части, и я бы хотел, чтобы все остальные разработчики брали с RWS пример, ведь уважение фанатов так просто не получают.

Моя оценка: 10/10.

Подписывайся на [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31466094-AlaGradus/?appid=379430][b]кураторскую страничку[/b][/url] и вступай в [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/alagradus][b] группу[/b][/url]. Будет интересно.

40705797.review:
[h1]Никогда еще убивать людей, не было так скушно.	[/h1]


Мне не очень нравился оригинал 97 года, он запомнилась лишь кривизной и жутковатой атмосферой. Заполучив в свою библиотеку переиздание, я решил глянуть, что же за продукт вышел из кузни безумия и аморальности -
Running With Scissors.

Перед нами примитивнейшая аркада, напоминающая Alien shooter, только вместо пришельцев нам противостоят силы правопорядка и неравнодушные граждане.
Общий настрой из холодно-колкого сменился на какие-то яркие, тошнотворные цвета.
[b]ГРАФИКА[/b] в целом выглядит неопрятно и мультяшно, на  экране телефона или планшета она бы  смотрелась хоть сколько-нибудь приемлимо. Непонятно зачем разработчикам понадобился Unreal Engine 4, отличия от версии прошлого века не такие уж большие, а требования у переиздания весьма нескромные при полном отсутствии физики, разрушения и интерактивности. Если только под интерактивностью вы не подразумеваете подрыв щедро расставленных красных бочек. В комплекте постоянные фризы и зависания.
 
[b] СЮЖЕТ.[/b]
Мы безумец, который под влиянием голосов в голове стал выносить окружающий люд. Ни предыстории, ни раскрытия персонажа, ни знакомства с миром игры нет.
Главный герой абсолютно не ощущается, равно как и умирающие болванчики. Получился этакий Packman с возможностью стрельбы: вы перемещаетесь по извилистым уровням и пуляете во врагов, в вас пуляют в ответ, заодно собираете патроны и аптеки. Все. От 1 до  последнего 23 уровня [b] ГАМЕПЛУЙ[/b] не изменится.

Однако если слегка копнуть, можно обнаружить основу сюжета и названия игры:
Разработчики вдохновились участившимися на тот момент случаями убиения американскими почтарями сослуживцев.
Острая тема, подвергнувшаяся общественному осуждению послужила игре отличной рекламой. Но это было остро именно на тот момент. 
Без подобного циничного наполнения, мы получаем просто скушный тир. Сейчас мало кого удивишь возможностью расстрелять невинных людей и выполняющих свой долг полицейский, в некрасивой и технологически отсталой изометрической аркаде.

Во время расцвета толерастии, баборабства и преклонения перед меньшинствами, можно было сделать такой сюжет, что он порвал бы сpаки всех феминисток, нигepийцев и прочих полоумных борцов за права.
А учитывая возможность коопа, можно было воплотить в игре события, рассказанные в  фильме «Боулинг для Колумбины». Тема школьного насилия и последующего выноса зaeбавших учеников и учителей всегда на слуху.
Представьте как было бы здорово планировать атаку на школу, идти по знакомым коридорам, расстреливая всех.
Далее баррикадироваться и вступать в перестрелку с полицией, стараясь убить как можно больше, прежде чем убьют вас.
Но увы, сюжет с 97 года, ни на грамм не изменился.

Стрелять не интересно, арсенал большой, но эффективнее всего ружье. Огонь раздражает и приносит больше вреда вам, чем противнику. Зачистка уровней от безликих ботов, способна разве что вызвать сонливость и желание выключить это творение.

Детей в игре нет, но есть страусы, только зачем мне убивать страусов ? Я против них ничего не имею.
Умирают людишки однотипно и невыразительно, актеры озвучки видимо были набраны с улицы, согласившись промычать пару фраз за банку пива. [b] МУЗЫКИ[/b] либо нет, либо лучше бы не было.
Настройки [b] ЗВУКА[/b] не сохраняются, хотя я сомневаюсь, что вы об этом узнаете- мало кому захочется возвращаться в эту обитель уныния, когда вокруг столько хороших игр.

Что хорошо в игре, так это арты, но это не заслуга переиздания, а наследие оригинала.

[quote=]Я рекомендую не прикасаться к этой игре, а обратить внимание на Hatred, в котором есть стиль, атмосфера боли и гнева, сюжет с финальной целью, интерактивность и разрушаемость.
Веселее смотреть как сохнет краска на заборе, чем играть в Postal redux.[/quote]

40394779.review: improved gameplay over the original version. biggest changes are that weapons do consistent damage now and you can see enemies when they go behind cover. overall much smoother and more enjoyable gameplay, other than that it's mostly just better graphics and more usable controls. only complaint i have is that the main campaign only lasts about 1.5 hours, but there's also an excess postage campaign and rampage mode where you try to get a high-score. there's no music in levels so you might as well listen to GG allin or some other edgy shit that fits the game well.

40369987.review:
Strong Points:

- Fun and quick to get into gameplay.
- Cool and dark atmosphere.
- Several filters to choose from that drastically change how the game looks.
- Fun weapons and powerful weapons such as flame-throwers, rocket-launchers.
- Decent variety of enemy types that will try to bring you down with different tactics.
- Lots of chances to make things explode.
- A satisfying amount of levels with many different locations.

Weak Points:

- Gets repetitive very quickly, not the type of game you're likely to want to play for prolonged amounts of time.
- Lack of melee weapons.
- Even though the promisse is there, campaing on normal dificulty doesn't force to use weapons creatively, you can go a long way with just shotgun and rocket-launcher. May be different on harder modes.
- Campaing lacks a more interesting closure and final levels, it kinda just ends.
- Could use more game modes.
- Although not game-breaking, I've experienced some frame rate issues at certain points.

Overall:

It's good mindless fun and a decent throwback, good to pick-up and play for a few minutes to an hour, if you're a fan of the Postal series, this is definitely one to get, if your not a Postal fan but you're looking for an isometric type of game, where you get to play as a ruthless killer then it's worth picking up on sale.

My score:

6/10

Never played Postal before and decided to go with the Redux version. Knew I was playing a old classic so no old memories for me.

I found this game at a  flea market and the cd was a bust when I took it home now that I found it on Steam I now at least have a working version because good old fashion classics know how to go over the top is what was then cutting edge.

I wasn't wrong and this game is a blast as I listen to the semi-lame one linners as you cut a path of destruction through foes and civilians alike. Like the touch of execution, a button rarely found in games today even. This is really a dark game.

The mouse and keyboard play pretty good but the duel analoge controler less so. But did have me scratching my head is once in a while the game would freeze for several seconds. Granted not enough to ruin the game but its there.

This this still a killer game? Killer definitely but it is showing it's age. But this isn't a bad thing because what it does it does well and makes for nice simple gameplay. Something I miss sometimes in the older games of yester-year.

This game still offers fun to be had and given it's price it's really not a risk. If you don't like it you are only out a few bucks but if you do, enjoy.

Can I recommend this game... yes it's fun but given it's age it's just about done too.

39893441.review:
Just finished the campain of Postal Redux - and I have to say I actually liked it. 

While the original Postal was not very playable (and is a bit ugly today), this version plays like a charm (used an XBox One controller), the graphic was fine under 1920x1080 and I encountered no bugs until the end.

The story is... well, nothing for kids. You play a madman on a rampage, killing everyone in sight. At least you get what you deserve in the end.

Comes with multiple weapons, achievements and trading cards. Even has cloud saves.

39893083.review:
Going postal — неологизм в американском английском языке, обозначающий неистовое, буйное поведение. Этот термин применяется для обозначения совершённого акта насилия или массового убийства, человеком, находящимся в психически нестабильном состоянии, по отношению к третьим лицам, например к коллегам по работе или случайно оказавшимся рядом людям, прямо не провоцировавших агрессора на подобные действия. 
Само выражение «to go postal» появилось в 1990-х годах в американских СМИ и связано с рядом инцидентов, произошедших в отделениях почтовой службы США в 80-90-х гг., в которых служащие отделений совершили массовые убийства своих коллег и рядовых граждан. Первый такой инцидент произошёл в 1986 году, когда работник почтового отделения в штате Оклахома Патрик Шеррилл (англ. Patrick Sherrill), находясь на своем рабочем месте, открыл огонь из пистолета, убив при этом 14 и ранив 6 служащих, а затем застрелился. Впоследствии, между 1986 и 1997 годами, произошло по меньшей мере 20 подобных инцидентов, в которых было убито более 40 человек.


Postal это игра длиною в жизнь. Фраза главного героя Show No Mercy отсылка к одноименному альбому группы Slayer, выпущенному в 1983 году. Это не просто игра, это философская притча. Овернасилие. Перебор...
